programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Part two of two. When a colleague is killed the crime-fighter must track down the murderer. Action drama, starring Chuck Norris.

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Baltar's latest scheme leads to Adama being summoned to the Council of Twelve to explain his decision to release dangerous Alliance enforcers captured on the planet Paradeen. Sci-fi capers, starring Lorne Greene and Richard Hatch

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Geordi experiments with a machine that allows him to control a probe through brain-power alone - then learns the technology could help save his mother, and disobeys Picard's orders in an attempt to rescue her

programme.title: Battle Star Wars (2019)
programme.desc: When the leader of the evil Coalition threatens to destroy a Rebel planet for its resources, his daughter has no choice but to join the Rebel side and fight for what is right. Sci-fi drama, starring Alyson Gorske, Aimee Stolte and Justin Berti

programme.title: Escape from Mars (1999)
programme.desc: Five astronauts embark on the first manned trip to Mars, and have to deal with inferior computers and fearsome big business interest as well as all the problems the red planet throws at them. Sci-fi drama, starring Christine Elise, Peter Outerbridge and Kathleen Moore

programme.title: Legend Lowdown
programme.desc: Take a look at all the latest movies and series coming your way this month

programme.title: The Philadelphia Experiment (2012)
programme.desc: An experiment to turn a ship invisible during the Second World War leads to it disappearing without trace. Decades later, an attempt to repeat the procedure brings the vessel back. A surviving crew member is found on board who has not aged a day and is convinced the process will lead to disaster if not stopped. Sci-fi thriller remake, starring Nicholas Lea and Malcolm McDowell

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk sets Scotty up with a date to help him recover from a recent injury, but doesn't bargain on his friend becoming the centre of a murder investigation. Sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner and James Doohan

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Part one of two. Riker goes looking for Picard, who has failed to return from an archaeological trip - only to be told he has been vaporised in a bar-room brawl. However, his attempt to bring the killers to justice leaves him in the clutches of ruthless mercenaries. Patrick Stewart and Jonathan Frakes star

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Apollo is captured by a mysterious stranger and enlisted in a peculiar errand of mercy to save a planet from nuclear annihilation. Sci-fi adventure, starring Richard Hatch

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Adventure with the modern-day lawman whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West. Alex Cahill is threatened by former Sheriff Baker who has served his sentence and is now out for revenge

programme.title: Red (2008)
programme.desc: Elderly, reclusive widower Avery Ludlow is left distraught when his only companion in life - a 14-year-old dog named Red - is murdered by three teenagers. After tracking the youths down, Avery demands the parents take action against the youths but after being turned away, he decides to dish out justice by any means necessary. Thriller, starring Brian Cox, Noel Fisher, Tom Sizemore and Kyle Gallner

programme.title: Shut In (2016)
programme.desc: While a fierce storm rages outside, a reclusive woman living with her catatonic son becomes convinced her house is haunted by the ghost of a young boy. Psychological thriller, starring Naomi Watts and Oliver Platt

programme.title: The Void (2016)
programme.desc: Shortly after delivering a patient to an understaffed hospital, a police officer experiences strange and violent occurrences seemingly linked to a group of mysterious hooded figures. Thriller, starring Aaron Poole and Kenneth Welsh

programme.title: Paradise Cove (2021)
programme.desc: A couple inherit a Malibu beach house and begin renovations, only to be constantly sabotaged by an unstable homeless woman. Thriller, starring Kristin Bauer van Straten

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: The Federation's demand to allow an unusual cargo aboard leads to the Enterprise being overrun by small furry creatures which breed at an alarming rate and feast on a rare wheat grain. Sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Part two of two. The search for fragments of an ancient Vulcan super-weapon reaches its end, as Riker wins the mercenaries' confidence by helping them attack the Enterprise, but his reward is a challenge to kill Picard. Patrick Stewart, Jonathan Frakes and Robin Curtis star

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: Starbuck enlists Apollo's help to pursue his former love onto sister ship the Celestra, where they soon get caught up in an armed revolt. Sci-fi shenanigans, starring Dirk Benedict and Richard Hatch

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger

programme.title: The Titan (2018)
programme.desc: With the Earth's resources nearly exhausted, a fighter pilot and his family participate in an experiment into man's genetic evolution in space. Sci-fi thriller, starring Sam Worthington and Taylor Schilling

programme.title: Jackals (2017)
programme.desc: An estranged family hires a cult deprogrammer to take back their teenage son from a murderous cult, but find themselves under siege when the cultists surround their cabin, demanding the boy back. Horror, starring Johnathon Schaech, Stephen Dorff and Deborah Kara Unger

programme.title: Seal Team VI: Journey into Darkness (2008)
programme.desc: A black-ops team find their covert mission in Iraq compromised, and the harrowing consequences change the course of the conflict. Drama based on real events, starring Ken Gamble

programme.title: The Young Cannibals (2020)
programme.desc: A group of friends on a camping holiday are tricked into consuming human flesh, which summons a creature determined to hunt them down as they fight to escape. Horror, starring Megan Purvis

programme.title: Blood River (1991)
programme.desc: A drifter guns down the man who murdered his parents then flees for his life, fearing the dead man's powerful father will seek revenge. He receives shelter from a mysterious old man, but starts to realise his saviour may not have his best interests in mind. Western, starring Rick Schroder, Wilford Brimley and Adrienne Barbeau

programme.title: Star Trek
programme.desc: Kirk is transported to the planet Triskelion, where he becomes a slave and finds himself forced to fight for his life in an ancient gladiatorial arena. Sci-fi adventure, starring William Shatner

programme.title: Star Trek: The Next Generation
programme.desc: Data has a bad dream which becomes a real-life nightmare for the Enterprise crew. Sci-fi drama, starring Brent Spiner

programme.title: Battlestar Galactica
programme.desc: When the Galactica crew detects that a Cylon Basestar has swung around to attempt to intercept the refugee fleet, Commander Adama decides to attack

programme.title: Walker, Texas Ranger
programme.desc: Walker's investigation of a cashpoint robbery becomes a race to catch two criminals before they are found by a bounty hunter. Adventure with the modern-day ranger whose crime-solving methods are rooted firmly in the Old West. Starring Chuck Norris

programme.title: Memorial Day (2011)
programme.desc: A Second World War veteran offers to tell his grandson the stories behind his service in the conflict. Years later, the child has grown up to also become a soldier, and finds the old man's tales help him to cope with the challenges he faces serving in Iraq. Drama, starring Jonathan Bennett and James Cromwell, with his real-life son John playing his character as a younger man

programme.title: Circus of Horrors (1960)
programme.desc: Anton Diffring stars as a deranged plastic surgeon who offers crooks the chance to start afresh by providing them with a new appearance - on condition that they staff his run-down circus. It's not long before some of his customers decide to renege on the deal and escape his clutches - prompting him to embark on a murderous spree. Top-class chiller, a genre classic and must-see for aficionados of Sixties horror films, with Donald Pleasance giving his all as an unfortunate ringmaster, alongside Erika Remberg, Yvonne Monlaur and Jane Hylton

programme.title: Jeepers Creepers (2001)
programme.desc: A brother and sister are driving home from college when they witness a mysterious truck driver disposing of what appears to be a human corpse at an isolated building. They are soon hunted by the strange motorist, who is not what he appears to be. Horror, starring Gina Philips, Justin Long and Jonathan Breck

programme.title: Wind Chill (2007)
programme.desc: A college student eager to get home for Christmas accepts a lift from a classmate. In an attempt to reach their destination before a severe storm hits them, the pair take a shortcut down a remote country lane, where they are run off the road by a speeding vehicle. As the stranded duo face the harsh winter elements with no food, water or heat, they gradually begin to suspect they are not alone. Thriller, starring Emily Blunt, Ashton Holmes and Martin Donovan

programme.title: Lovejoy
programme.desc: When faced with a hefty dentist bill, Lovejoy agrees to settle it by investigating the alleged death by drowning of Terence Sullivan, a fellow antiques dealer. programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine

programme.title: Jonathan Creek
programme.desc: Alan Davies' consulting detective returns to pit his inquiring mind against another festive mystery. According to a local legend, the house known as Daemons' Roost was once home to Jacob Surtees, a 19th-century sorcerer thought to have summoned the powers of Hell to terrorise and subjugate visitors. Now, it is home to Nathan Clore, an ailing film director with a dark secret, who has summoned his step-daughter Alison back home to impart to her the chilling truth of what happened to her mother and sister, who died in mysterious circumstances when she was just a child. However, mere days before Alison arrives, Nathan suffers a debilitating stroke, leaving him unable to shed any further light on the matter. Determined to get to the bottom of the mystery, Alison calls in old acquaintance Jonathan Creek to help. Also starring Sarah Alexander, Warwick Davis, Emun Elliott and Ken Bones

programme.title: New Tricks
programme.desc: While Brian spends time at home making peace with himself over his dismissal, he agrees to help Esther's friend Margaret find her missing brother Peter, in the interest of keeping his mind active. Peter was the accountant of a man who has gone to prison for the murder of his wife, so Brian visits the convict hoping he will be able to assist. However, his investigation begins to encroach on the Ucos team's efforts to track down a conman who may be connected to several outstanding cases. With Rosalind Ayres and Art Malik

programme.title: Silent Witness
programme.desc: Feature length episode. Investigating the motives of the victim's neighbour, a former soldier, Sam is able to produce few solid leads. However, when the informant is found dead, the intrepid pathologist uncovers an Army cover-up. Drama, starring Amanda Burton

programme.desc: A driver is ambushed by a carjacking gang outside his home in Birmingham. Data downloaded off their mobile phones helps link the gang to nearly a hundred car thefts and break-ins

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: A seven-year-old boy suffers a fatal electric shock during a family visit to their local pub, leading to the discovery of a catalogue of electrical faults. Plus, a fraudster bombarding people with scam text messages claiming to be from well-known organisations

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts visits a property in Southampton in a stunning setting, right beside the river, and another in Wellington, Shropshire being renovated with family very much in mind. Plus, a revisit to Clay Cross, Derbyshire, where in October 2018 Dion Dublin saw a plot of land with exciting development potential

programme.title: Bargain Hunt

programme.desc: Called out to an ongoing campaign of vandalism, Rob discovers decades of pain and a guilty secret, and comes to see the dangers of clinging to past traumas. Zara enjoys her first day at Letherbridge University, Emma regrets the events of the previous night, and Al is curious about why Rosie has returned to the Mill

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The experts restore a small broken statue, a clock that survived the journey from Trinidad to England, and a glamorous painting that's seen better days

Lola comes home to be greeted by the square who rally round the family for support. Freddie tries to recruit a dream-team for The Vic pub quiz

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year millions of tons of waste are dumped in landfill sites, but how safe are they? Reporter Amber Haque investigates a Staffordshire landfill which residents claim has affected their health and examines the potentially toxic legacy of historic landfill sites

programme.desc: Rav Wilding and YouTuber Jim Browning join forces with ethical hackers to hunt down cyber criminals. Using the same remote-access technology that criminals use to scam their victims, the team hacks the hackers and monitors their operation

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs work in pairs to create special effects make-up for the BBC show Ghosts for the judging of the show's Hair and Make-up Designer Natalie Pateman. At Glow Up Studios the special effects challenges continue as they have to create a character that represents one of the zodiac signs for guest judge Vanessa Davis. In the Face Off, the bottom two contestants work against the clock to produce a symmetrical crystal embellishment design

programme.title: Defenders UK

programme.desc: JJ Chalmers revamps a vintage suitcase, blacksmith Kev Paxton attempts to transform a metal birdcage and screen printer Zoe Murphy sets to work on a mid 20th-century coffee table

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley meets a retired couple from a town in Essex who are hoping to find a new home in a village as close to the county's coast as their 475,000 budget will allow

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts hear the stories of a teddy bear, a set of vintage golf clubs and a wall clock that once hung in a school, before mending the items for their owners

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kelly Jo's makes a shocking revelation, causing problems for Nicky and her family and Amy finds herself infatuated with a colleague. Kim's day goes from bad to worse after a conversation between her and Lindon is overheard before a meeting with the governors

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals kick off with a visit to Gloucestershire's Fire Service College. Cooking in teams for the first time, the hopefuls have three and a half hours to serve a feast for 120 of the emergency responders and trainers. Back in the studio, they use their creativity to tinned and jarred food into a MasterChef-worthy dish - but for one of them, this will be their final challenge

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: Selby, Gloria and Lenny go on a road trip in search of Costello after a troubling call from Iris. Some upsetting news pushes Costello to her breaking point and she abandons her dreams to lead an ordinary life for her daughter's sake but the disappointment won't shift and she contemplates a different ending

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, rugby league great Robbie Hunter-Paul, double Paralympic gold medallist Maisie Summers-Newton and former Bolton Wanderers footballer Fabrice Muamba join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben struggles to accept Lola's prognosis and accuses the family of accepting it too easily, after a heart to heart with Phil he starts to see the error in his ways. Tensions in the Slater household continue to rise and Freddie receives an ADHD referral. Plus, there is a glimmer of hope for Chelsea and Ravi's relationship

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A Gloucestershire woman brings in her King Charles II painting, hoping Lucia Scalisi can restore it to its crowning glory, and silversmith Brenton West works on a well-travelled trunk, which holds cherished memories for a mother and daughter. Goldsmith Richard Talman tries to reunite the broken pieces of an engagement ring and toy restorers Julie and Amanda revive a toy donkey that comforted a young child after he lost his mother and his sister

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Patrick Grant and Esme Young welcome 12 new sewers to the competition in Leeds. For their first pattern challenge, the sewers make a top with a twist at its centre to give them a straightforward construction task with an added brain teaser. In the transformation task the competitors take the traditional 'office uniform' of a pencil skirt and a blouse and make it reflect their own style. Finally in the made-to-measure challenge, the contestants try to perfectly fit a dress with cut-out details

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Mikey makes a decision that sends shockwaves through the masseria, and leaves many of the residents questioning the seriousness of each other's matches. Dannii Minogue gathers the boys for their first Chemistry Test to couples discover what brings them together and what moves them apart

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue shakes things up by welcoming three single men into the masseria, to see if some of the couples who have matched up are as devoted as they appear. While the new arrivals throw some serious moves at the party, Josh takes a break to reveal something important to Mikey before the boys all weigh up their options for the second Kiss-Off

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Clive Myrie's Italian Road Trip
programme.desc: Clive travels to the Conegliano region in the foothills of the Alps, to find out about the production of his favourite tipple Prosecco. One of the country's few female female wine-makers explains about the grapes they use - and when the importance of the harvest - before inviting him to spend the night in a giant wine barrel. Moving on, vintage car fan Clive joins the 100 Miglia rally and hunts for antiques in the hilltop town of Asolo

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents the contest from Leominster in Herefordshire, with Kate Bliss and Philip Serrell as expert advisors. Eric also visits Hereford Cathedral's 17th-century library where the books are kept under lock and key

programme.title: Rick Stein's Cornwall
programme.desc: The chef visits the fishing port of Boscastle and finds a seafood restaurant in a building which once housed rockets used to fire safety ropes out to sinking ships. A trip to Cornwall's only dedicated organic mushroom farm inspires him to cook a stir fry with 'lion's mane' mushrooms, which it is said can regrow your neurons. Rick also discovers a reason so many Germans love Cornwall

programme.title: Designing the Hebrides
programme.desc: Banjo Beale and his team travel to Skye to transform a dated cafe and bookshop, and the interior designer takes the bold decision to spend almost all his budget on a set of huge stained-glass windows. Far from home and with tricky logistics, will this job push the team to the limit and will Banjo's ambitious gamble pay off with his clients?

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: Chef James Martin journeys throughout the UK to explore how each region's conditions influence the flavour of local ingredients. After taking to the skies to get an overview of how Britain's landscape and climate affect where, what and how people farm and fish, he then touches down and meets the locals who work the land. He begins in the south-east of England, where he finds out why Kent cherries are so sweet, cooks Hastings Dover sole and prepares a cherry trifle

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Guide to enjoying summer in the countryside. Chris Packham offers tips on wildlife to look out for, Nadiya Hussain provides a barbecue recipe for lamb with rhubarb glaze, and Sean Fletcher goes on a bikepacking adventure. Narrated by Gethin Jones

programme.title: Eat Well for Less?
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace and Chris Bavin help a family of fussy eaters in Gosport on the south coast lower their food bills and change their unhealthy eating habits. James and Rianna Drew have two children, Tallulah-Belle who is three and Penelope who is one. Tallulah-Belle was born 11 weeks early weighing just one pound and now suffers with chronic lung disease. The couple spent over two years in hospital with her, living on convenience freezer food and takeaways, and now she is home their diets have not changed. Can Gregg and Chris help this family get their spending and eating habits back on track?

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The contestants pair up to redesign cafes in the seaside town of Margate, with each person responsible for their own zone. One team decide that art deco is the way to go and choose a very bold colour palette, inspired by one of Margate's most famous artists, JW Turner. The other team channel the colours of the sea with cool blues and vintage shutters to create a laid-back feel. But which one will impress Michelle Ogundehin and guest judge Ross Bailey the most? Presented by Alan Carr

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents previously unseen finds from the show's travels round the country, visiting Muncaster Castle, the Bowes Museum and Norwich Cathedral. Antiques experts include Kate Bateman, Paul Laidlaw, Jonathan Pratt, James Lewis and Thomas Plant, with items ranging from a pair of Lalique vases to a 9.5mm projector. Paul also takes a tour around Powis Castle in Wales, finding out about their collection of Indian artefacts housed on site in the Clive Museum

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak go toe-to-toe testing their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games across the week

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo returns to travel by train to more places around the British Isles, beginning by heading to the self-governing Isle of Man - a paradise for rail lovers. His first stop on the Manx Electric Railway is the capital of Douglas, where he reveals the island's parliament the Tynwald is older than Westminster, before the Isle of Man Steam Railway takes him down the east coast to Castletown, from where he heads to the Norse Castle Rusheword

programme.title: Grand Tours of Scotland's Rivers
programme.desc: Paul Murton explores the history of the River Nith in the south-west, from its source in a remote forest to the shining sands of the Solway Firth. Heading downstream, he hears the story of the Knockshinnoch mining disaster - how 116 men were saved from entombment after a massive earth collapse. He also learns about the first man to make a bicycle with pedals, heads to the riverside home of Robbie Burns and finds out how a Dumfries man helped Neil Armstrong walk on the moon

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: Monty Don and Joe Swift review some of the 35 inspirational gardens on offer at the show, as well as exploring the immaculate displays of growers in the Great Pavilion. Adam Frost delves into a garden created with community in mind, Arit Anderson heads to the ingenious houseplant studios and Frances Tophill takes a first look at the planting styles to look out for at the show. Carol Klein gets viewers in the mood for summer with beautiful blooms and Sophie Raworth is on hand to welcome the royal family to the show

programme.title: University Challenge
programme.desc: The second and concluding semi-final sees two teams of four students battling it out to make it to the climax of the competition and the chance to take home the trophy. Jeremy Paxman asks the questions

programme.title: Once Upon a Time in Northern Ireland
programme.desc: Stories of the Troubles from people on all sides of the conflict, beginning by looking at how the situation in Northern Ireland in the late-1960s deteriorated from a time of relative peace. As the civil rights movement gained pace, demanding equal rights for Catholics, the Provisional IRA came to the fore, causing the British Army to be deployed. With the situation compounded by tactical mistakes, soldiers quickly found themselves caught up in violent clashes - leading to 13 unarmed Catholics being shot dead by British paratroopers in Derry on what becomes known as Bloody Sunday

programme.title: QI XS
programme.desc: Highlights from recent series of the comedy panel show, featuring clips on the theme of travel, hosted by Sandi Toksvig with regular panellist Alan Davies and guests

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: The day's important national and international news stories, presented by Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Do the Right Thing (1989)
programme.desc: Racial tensions erupt in a Brooklyn neighbourhood on the hottest day of the summer. The simmering conflicts centre on the Italian-owned local pizza parlour, as a minor dispute gradually escalates into full-blown violence. Drama, directed by and starring Spike Lee, with Danny Aiello, John Turturro, Ossie Davis, Rosie Perez and Samuel L Jackson

programme.title: Countryfile
programme.desc: For Mental Health Awareness Week, Charlotte Smith visits a farm in Cornwall to see how their support programmes based on agriculture help people with mental and physical wellbeing. Marathon runner Haroon Mota goes hiking in Snowdonia, exploring why the great outdoors is so important to his mental wellbeing. Datshiane Navanayagam looks at the impact increasing debt is having on farmers, and Adam Henson reports on how women in agriculture are facing up to the mental health challenges of rural isolation

programme.title: Wrexham: Hollywood or Bust!
programme.desc: Wrexham AFC are one of the oldest football clubs in the world, with a home in the Racecourse Ground that dates back virtually to the dawn of the sport. Theirs is a history that stretches back further than most, with drama and memorable moments to rival any club. This documentary recounts that history, while revealing why promotion to the Football League under Hollywood-based owners Ryan Reynolds and Rob McElhenney would mean so much to the club's fans

programme.title: Turkey: Empire of Erdogan
programme.desc: First in a two-part documentary about the life and career of the Turkish president. Recep Tayyip Erdogan was born at a time when Turkey was ruled by the secular elite. Joining an Islamist party, he became hugely popular as mayor of Istanbul. But with the national constitution forbidding the mixing of religion and politics, Erdogan was sent to prison and banned from being an MP for life - only to stage an astonishing comeback

programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.desc: JJ Chalmers is patrolling the forecourt of Wallyford recycling centre in East Lothian, hoping to redirect some metal railings, a tired writing bureau and a collection of marbles

programme.title: Coast to Coast Food Festival
programme.desc: Sean Fletcher explores the food market in Hay-on-Wye, getting tips on home growing and finding out the secret to making fudge. Chef Julie Lin discovers bargains in world food stores and supermarket aisles, and food journalist Leyla Kazim lifts the lid on smoothies, while Ryan Hand finds out how to get wood-fired pizza perfection in an oven

programme.title: Coastal Defenders
programme.desc: The dive team are charged with clearing abandoned boats causing an eyesore and navigational hazard in a picturesque part of the river. Facing the threat of dangerous chemicals, metal boats and lots of mud the team must chase the tide in what is one of the most unusual daily commutes. But when disaster strikes, the divers are left stranded into the night on one of their most challenging jobs yet

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef continues his journey across the UK, as he visits south Wales and discovers why Welsh mountain lamb is a prized delicacy. He also forages for free food on the beaches of Pembrokeshire, and creates two dishes - lamb cooked in hay with a tabbouleh salad and a seafood starter

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Chris Packham and Megan McCubbin visit the Lake District and take some alpacas for a walk. Simon Reeve takes the plunge when he tries wild swimming and Nadiya Hussain demonstrates her twist on a classic summer pudding, Eton mess

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: Michelle Dockery narrates a documentary examining the wildlife of the east Asian country, beginning on the central island of Honshu. It is home to more than 100 million people, but most of it is mountainous and this wilderness is home to an astonishing range of wildlife, and people and nature are drawn together in the most unexpected ways

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The three semi-finalists upgrade lakeside holiday lodges in the heart of the Cotswolds, each of which includes an open-plan kitchen, living and dining space and an outside terrace. The buildings are decidedly beige, giving the designers a blank canvas to work on - and knowing they are only one week away from the final they really go to town, with schemes ranging from bold primary colours inspired by a classic 1980s movie to a sophisticated monochrome look. Michelle Ogundehin judges their efforts with help from designer Abigail Ahern

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: From West Somerset at Crowcombe Court, an English mansion that dates back to 1739. Antiques expert Elizabeth Talbot finds a tribal weapon that was part of a collection gathered by a sea captain on his travels and Thomas Plant hears all about a Victorian gin bottle that was buried in a tip excavated to make way for the London Olympic ground. Presenter Paul Martin follows in the footsteps of Romantic poet Samuel Taylor Coleridge, who wrote his best-known work whilst he was living in Somerset

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo begins this leg of his journey at Liverpool's historic waterfront, where he visits the International Slavery Museum at Royal Albert Dock, before heading underground to discover one of the most important and secret rooms of the Second World War, the Royal Navy's Western Approaches Headquarters. His next stop is Crosby on the Merseyside coastline in Sefton, before making his way north to Blackpool, the last stop on this leg of his journey

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts visits more archaeological digs around the country, finding out about discoveries that shed new light on British history during the prehistoric, Roman, Saxon and Tudor eras. In this edition, she examines a Dutch ship sunk by the English, a Cornish Roman fort and a 5,000-year-old Neolithic monument

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The BBC gardening team present the sights and sounds of the famous events, with highlights of the gardens and tips for amateur horticulturists

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: When an armed gang of jewellery thieves robs 300,000 worth of gold from a Birmingham jewellery store, police need to use forensic evidence to track down the gold. West Midland Police's Force Priorities Unit, a specialist team tasked with completing the most high risk jobs and manhunts, swarm the local area to find witnesses and CCTV that could give them a lead

programme.title: Colin from Accounts
programme.desc: Ashley invites her party-loving friends to Echo Park to celebrate her birthday - testing her relationship with Gordon in the process. Comedy, starring Patrick Brammall and Harriet Dyer

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Vice (2018)
programme.desc: The story of Dick Cheney, an unassuming bureaucratic Washington insider who quietly wielded immense power as vice president to George W Bush, reshaping America and the globe in the ways that are still felt today. Biographical comedy drama, starring Christian Bale, Amy Adams, Sam Rockwell and Steve Carell

programme.title: Murder in the Pacific
programme.desc: The documentary continues with the investigation into the sinking of the Rainbow Warrior in May 1985. Just one day after the explosions that sunk the Greenpeace ship, police were overwhelmed with calls from people claiming to have spotted unusual goings on. One witness led to Swiss tourists Alain and Sophie Turenge. They came into the station voluntarily but their inability to answer simple questions led police to doubt their identities

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The fifth and final week of heats gets under way, with another nine contestants aiming to impress Gregg Wallace and John Torode in the opening Audition Round. John and Gregg don't witness them cook in the MasterChef kitchen, but taste each dish in the Tasting Room and judge each contestant's food solely on the plate that is put in front of them. After tasting all nine plates, they pick their three favourite dishes, giving those cooks a well-earned MasterChef apron and immunity from cooking in the next round

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The seven best home cooks from the first rounds return to face notoriously tough food critic Grace Dent who asks them to create the ultimate pot luck supper dish. The contestants that survive the first challenge are then asked by judges Gregg Wallace and John Torode to cook a dish using spice. With just four places in the quarter final up for grabs, the pressure is on

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy sees potential in a piece of land in Hitchin, Herefordshire while Jacqui looks round a flat in London's Penge. Dion visits a terraced house in Nottingham

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Jules Hudson helps a retired couple to find a new home in the Northumberland countryside on a 375,000 budget so that they can live closer to their families

programme.title: Inside the Factory
programme.desc: Gregg Wallace visits the factory making 432 million crumpets every year, where quality controller Stuart Jones shows him the speciality flour that includes 13 varieties of wheat. Cherry Healey learns the science of how to make the perfect batter for pancakes and visits a factory in Manchester that makes another British favourite - Eccles cakes, which are shipped all over the world. Historian Ruth Goodman reveals the long journey of how crumpets got their rise and eventually their bubbles, and traces the history of our obsession with toasting our baked goods

programme.title: Nicky Campbell
programme.desc: Calls on the day's talking points, with views and experiences from across the UK. Call 08085 909693 (calls are free from mobiles and landlines)

programme.title: BBC News
programme.desc: The latest national and international stories as they break

programme.title: Politics Live
programme.desc: The latest stories from Westminster and beyond

programme.title: Impossible
programme.desc: Rick Edwards hosts the quiz in which contestants compete for the chance to win 10,000, with a single 'impossible' answer knocking them out for the day

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: Jeremy Vine hosts the quiz in which the winners of famous game shows work as a team to tackle a new set of challengers hoping to win a cash prize

programme.title: James Martin's Food Map of Britain
programme.desc: The chef explores the county of Gloucestershire and the Cotswolds, where he cooks a River Severn salmon with asparagus and Hollandaise. James also rustles up ham croquettes with garlic rapeseed mayo, and hears from one farmer who thinks his land produces the country's best virgin rapeseed oil

programme.title: A Countryside Summer
programme.desc: Adam Henson finds out about lavender and its benefits and Margherita Taylor learns about the decline of wild meadows and what can be done to help. Mary Berry demonstrates what to do with a harvest of summer fruits when she makes a tasty smoothie

programme.title: Japan: Earth's Enchanted Islands
programme.desc: In the south-west of Japan, the Ryukyu Islands stretch towards the tropics and all life on them is influenced by the power of the sea, with volcanos and typhoons forces to be reckoned with. Michelle Dockery narrates a journey beginning at an island at the top of the chain and travelling south, revealing unexpected stories of isolation, unique wildlife and unsolved mysteries

programme.title: Interior Design Masters
programme.desc: The two finalists go head to head, each taking on the redesign of a trendy bar in London's vibrant Soho district. They have three days to make over the ground-floor bar and an intimate basement cocktail lounge - and to help, both contestants have a fellow team-mate, plus a team of trades. One designer goes all-out, relocating the bar to the other side of the room - but the more they rip out, the more it becomes a demolition zone. Down the road, there is indecision and angst as the other finalist realises just how much is at stake. Who will win the career-defining contract to design an upmarket apartment on the Cornish coast?

programme.title: Flog It!
programme.desc: Paul Martin presents from Bletchley Park in Buckinghamshire, where antique experts Charlie Ross and Mark Stacey find an autograph book and a tea set

programme.title: Richard Osman's House of Games
programme.desc: Mehreen Baig, Clare Balding, Jamie Laing and Mike Wozniak continue to test their general knowledge skills in a variety of trivia-based games

programme.title: Great Coastal Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey across the vast and beautiful Morecambe Bay, where he joins one of the town's last shrimpers to find out how potted shrimp is made, From there, Michael makes his way to Arnside on the Furness Line, where he discovers a magnificently quirky 17th century garden, and across the Arnside viaduct, he reaches Cartmel and its 12th century priory and a Michelin-starred restaurant

programme.title: Digging for Britain
programme.desc: Alice Roberts heads to a farmer's field in Rutland to examine evidence of a Roman barn conversion, featuring a three-room spa, including underfloor and in-wall central heating. She also finds out about the excavation of one of Henry VIII's lost forts in Hull, and hears from a team that discovered stunning 10,000-year-old hunting tools near Scarborough

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The BBC gardening team present the sights and sounds of the famous events, with highlights of the gardens and tips for amateur horticulturists

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: The FBI joins the investigation into the attack on the 2017 Las Vegas Harvest music festival, as doctors concentrate resources on treating the wounded most likely to survive at overwhelmed local hospitals. The lobby of the Tropicana Hotel looks like a disaster zone as it is strewn with concert-goers seeking shelter, while country music superstar Jason Aldean, his wife and band members are hunkered down in a tour bus riddled with bullet holes

programme.title: 11 Minutes: America's Deadliest Mass Shooting
programme.desc: A look at the impact the attack on the 2017 Las Vegas Harvest music festival had on survivors. Many are still searching for closure, while for some the bond they formed that night with strangers restored their faith in humanity, while for others activism is a way to channel their grief

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events with Kirsty Wark

programme.title: Weather
programme.desc: Preview of the UK's weather

programme.title: Unspun World with John Simpson
programme.desc: The BBC's world affairs editor reflects on the week's major global news stories, talking to local experts from around the world to go behind the headlines

programme.title: Forensics: The Real CSI
programme.desc: When an armed gang of jewellery thieves robs 300,000 worth of gold from a Birmingham jewellery store, police need to use forensic evidence to track down the gold. West Midland Police's Force Priorities Unit, a specialist team tasked with completing the most high risk jobs and manhunts, swarm the local area to find witnesses and CCTV that could give them a lead

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: A couple catch three masked men trying to steal a catalytic converter from under a car parked on their driveway, and capture the incident on a smartphone

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela Rippon, Gloria Hunniford and Julia Somerville question the new boss of one of the country's biggest energy firms on their customer service record. Plus, more frustration for customers of Britain's most complained about pay TV provider and, how one woman ended up with a 5000 bill for a car accident that wasn't her fault because she unwittingly dialled the wrong number

programme.title: Saving Lives in Leeds
programme.desc: Congenital heart surgeon Osama Jaber must perform lifesaving surgery on 15-day-old baby Callie-Mae, who was born with the two large arteries of her heart, the aorta and the pulmonary, in the wrong positions, meaning her body is not getting enough oxygenated blood. Neurosurgeon Kenan Deniz operates on 30-year-old Sam, who suffers from debilitating headaches, as she was born with a condition where the lower part of the brain pushes down onto her spine, putting pressure on the brainstem and spinal cord

programme.title: Gordon Ramsay's Future Food Stars
programme.desc: The semi-finalists have their social media skills tested as they are challenged to sell a local street food brand online, under the watchful eye of TIkTok sensation Uncle Roger. Next, Gordon tasks the contestants to devise a recipe to appear on the front page of Waitrose's in-house magazine, before presenting their creations in front of undercover experts including world-renowned food photographer, Mary McCartney. Who will impress Gordon and make it to the final?

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: The development of the steamship, from the earliest paddle boats and the first iron-hulled vessels to modern sport screw propellers and ships powered by steam turbines, such as the Royal Yacht Britannia

programme.title: Italy's Invisible Cities
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong and Dr Michael Scott explore the Italian city of Venice, using 3D technology to discover how a city built in a swamp came to be one of the most powerful locations in Medieval Europe. The pair dive deep into the many canals in this unique place to experience how its buildings still remain standing to this day, and highlight how Venice's beauty once masked a ruthless secret state, and a world of excess and vice

programme.title: Saving Venice
programme.desc: Documentary exploring how the Italian city is subject to constant environmental issues, which are becoming more commonplace due to the impact of climate change

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public

programme.title: Building Britain's Biggest Nuclear Power Station
programme.desc: Part two of two. Following the challenges involved with building the Hinkley Point C in the remote Somerset countryside, the first new nuclear power station in Britain for a generation. This time, the team creates an extensive flood defence system to protect the site from a nuclear disaster like the one that befell the Fukushima Daiichi power plant in Japan. Elsewhere, cameras follow specialists as they work to uncover unexploded Second World War bombs that threaten the installation of the 4500-tonne cooling water intake heads

programme.title: H2O: The Molecule That Made Us
programme.desc: Storm chasers and photographers track the global changes in storms and floods across America, while Nasa's Grace satellites reveal global overuse of aquifers

programme.title: Novels That Shaped Our World
programme.desc: The documentary explores how novels through the ages have embraced the class struggle, from Dickens, Gaskell and Hardy through to Robert Tressell's The Ragged-Trousered Philanthropists and the group of working-class writers who began to write their own stories in post-war Britain. With readings by Russell Tovey, Darren Boyd, Alex Macqueen, Emily Berrington, Freddie Fox, Rian Gordon and Olivia Barrowclough

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor presents a documentary examining excursion trains, which became popular from the 1840s onwards, with tourists taking day trips and holidays, and seeing parts of the country they had never seen before. Some trains were set up to satisfy the demand to witness public executions, whereas others transported people to horse racing and sporting events. Working-class northerners had access to the Lake District, however Lakeland resident William Wordsworth was initially unhappy about the new visitors

programme.title: Himalaya with Michael Palin
programme.desc: The adventurer travels along the Yangtze river into China, where he meets Mosuo singer Namu, who explains the region's traditional walking marriage ceremonies. He continues into India to marvel at one of Assam's great tea estates, makes the acquaintance of the local elephants and stays at a monastery where the monks introduce him to their unique dancing style

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live farther away from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Age of Steam
programme.desc: An examination of the major advances made with the invention of the steam turbine, which is still used today to generate electricity in coal-fired and nuclear power stations. Fred also discovers how the country's steam heritage is preserved by museums and societies throughout the country

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Lionel asks Jean to accompany him on an all-expenses-paid cruise, but she remains unmoved by his efforts to woo her. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer

programme.title: Whatever Happened to the Likely Lads?
programme.desc: Terry decides he would like to track down some of his former girlfriends - little suspecting the shocks that await him. James Bolam stars

programme.title: Expedition Volcano
programme.desc: Documentary following scientists studying some of the world's most dangerous active volcanos in the Democratic Republic of Congo. The first of two films explores Nyiragongo, which has erupted twice in the past 50 years, most recently in 2002, when it devastated the nearby city of Goma. However, it lies in a region troubled by war and humanitarian crises, which has made study of the volcano difficult. Former Royal Marine Aldo Kane is given the task of ensuring the team's safety

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Animation film based on the voice notes that two Afghan women exchanged in the months that followed the Taliban's return to power in 2021. Raha chose to stay in Kabul, where she was confronted with the violence of the regime. Marwa left with her husband just in time and found herself in a refugee camp in Abu Dhabi, waiting to be welcomed into another country

programme.title: Escape from Kabul Airport
programme.desc: The inside story of the largest airlift in modern US history, which took place in August 2021 when America withdrew its troops from Afghanistan, marking the end of its longest war. The film combines never-before-seen on-the-ground archival footage from the evacuation, alongside interviews with evacuees, eyewitnesses, US Marines and Taliban fighters

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby investigates the importance of the sea to trade and to the individual livelihoods of coastal communities. He sails along the west coast of Scotland, starting at Craobh Haven and along the Crinan Canal, a waterway designed by East Lothian engineer John Rennie to take 120 miles off the journey from the west coast to Glasgow and safely avoid the turbulent waters around the Mull of Kintyre. He also climbs aboard the last working sea-going Clyde puffer, where he earns his keep shovelling coal in the steam room, and reflects on the role played by the river in both trade and shipbuilding

programme.title: Storyville
programme.desc: Documentary laying bare Chechnya's deadly war against its gay citizens, which reveals the bravery of those running rescue missions to protect the republic's LGBTQ community

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Liz McIvor examines how the railways enabled people to live farther away from the places where they worked, visiting London and the south east of England, the nation's largest commuter zone

programme.title: The Fifteen Billion Pound Railway
programme.desc: The concluding episode follows the aftermath of the shock news that the Elizabeth Line has been delayed by over a year, and will cost hundreds of millions of pounds more than planned. As the drama unfolds, engineers, technicians and train staff pull together to work on borrowed time, and must learn to operate the new trains and test out the new twin tunnels under London before it can open to the public

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies
programme.desc: Part one of two. Jim Al-Khalili explores the universe at the smallest scales, from tiny atoms to vast galaxies. The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science

programme.title: Lucky Sunil
programme.desc: Andrew Davies's satirical drama telling the story of Sunil, an Indian law student who travels to London in the hope of making it big. But he finds his new life is not quite as easy as he expected it to be, and descends into a world of hefty debts and dodgy deals among Britain's Asian emigres. Starring Kulvinder Ghir. Originally broadcast in 1988

programme.title: Andrew Davies: Rewriting the Classics
programme.desc: Documentary exploring the creative process of the screenwriter behind some of TV's most acclaimed adaptations of classic literature, from the 1995 version of Pride and Prejudice to the 2018 dramatisation of Victor Hugo's Les Miserables. He also discusses how to go about transforming sprawling, lengthy and detailed novels into primetime drama, turning one art form into another altogether different one. With contributions from authors Sarah Waters and Helen Fielding, actors Dominic West and Olivia Colman, and industry figures Jane Tranter and Sue Birtwhistle

programme.title: Oak Tree: Nature's Greatest Survivor
programme.desc: George McGavin explores one of the great icons of the British countryside - the oak tree. Studying a 400-year-old tree throughout the different seasons of the year, George investigates its surprisingly sophisticated biology, how it adapts to its ever-changing environment and why it has become such an important part of the countryside

programme.title: Railways: The Making of a Nation
programme.desc: Thanks to the advent of rail, moving produce around at speed suddenly became possible, allowing fresh meat, wet fish, dairy, fruit and vegetables to be widely available. With a new system of rapid transport it was now possible for London to enjoy food supplies from all corners of the nation. As Liz McIvor reveals, Victorian men and women developed a taste for one particular dish that would be popular with the masses for generations to come - fish and chips

programme.title: Secrets of Size: Atoms to Supergalaxies

The first episode examines objects too small to glimpse with the naked eye, and reveals how nanomaterials such as graphene are revolutionising engineering, medicine, computing, electronics and environmental science

programme.desc: Dr Maggie uncovers the people and the missions that are tasked with looking for aliens in space and asks whether life really is out there and how will we find out. Her Top 5 is of the places where we might find extraterrestrial life. Buckle up, its time to go Out Of This World!

programme.desc: The sheep and his friends decide to take action against the smelly farmer and set about trying to give him a wash

programme.title: Danger Mouse
programme.desc: Danger Mouse's over-reliance on gadgets prompts Colonel K to send his top agent on a tech-free nature retreat. Back at HQ Penfold is tasked with protecting the entire world from the threat of super-villainy. Stripped off his gadgets, DM struggles to adapt to life in the wilderness and, when a talking pinecone called Conni begins to offer him survival tips, he begins to question his own sanity. Soon enough, Delilah catches wind of DM's presence and she plots to destroy him as a means of getting back into her Dad's good books. With the voices of Alexander Armstrong and Kevin Eldon

programme.desc: The latest headlines

Lola comes home to be greeted by the square who rally round the family for support. Freddie tries to recruit a dream-team for The Vic pub quiz

programme.title: Weatherman Walking
programme.desc: Derek Brockway, visits Usk for a stunning 10-mile circular walk which starts and ends at Usk Castle. Along the way, he sees the landscape from above as he hitches a ride in a glider, learns about an ancient orchard, visits some community allotments and helps local youngsters plant sunflowers. Archaeologist Dr Erin Lloyd Jones finds out what the Romans did for Wales and Matthew Bassett explores decorative Oriental-inspired tinware once made in the town

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year millions of tons of waste are dumped in landfill sites, but how safe are they? Reporter Amber Haque investigates a Staffordshire landfill which residents claim has affected their health and examines the potentially toxic legacy of historic landfill sites

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: The daily reality for rookie nurses - especially in A&E - as they deal with life-and-death situations and everything in between. Twenty-two-year-old Mikey is part of the trauma team tasked with helping a teenage rugby player brought in by ambulance with severe concussion in Carmarthen. In Aberystwyth, 24-year-old nurse is Leah is unphased when a patient arrives having suffered a freak lawnmower accident which led to an amputation. programme.title: You Don't Look...
programme.desc: Laura Gardner designs a special effects make-up look for Dafydd to help him visualise how living with depression feels for him

programme.title: Rookie Nurses
programme.desc: The daily reality for rookie nurses - especially in A&E - as they deal with life-and-death situations and everything in between. Twenty-two-year-old Mikey is part of the trauma team tasked with helping a teenage rugby player brought in by ambulance with severe concussion in Carmarthen. In Aberystwyth, 24-year-old nurse is Leah is unphased when a patient arrives having suffered a freak lawnmower accident which led to an amputation. Amid medical dramas on the wards, there's a big moment for health care assistant Caitlin who, after years of studying, is on her way to collect her new nurses uniform, and is excited to join her colleagues in her blues

programme.desc: Mikey makes a decision that sends shockwaves through the masseria, and leaves many of the residents questioning the seriousness of each other's matches. programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Alexander Armstrong hosts the quiz in which contestants try to record the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Former Coronation Street Sally Lindsay reveals the correct answers and comments on the players' scores

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Roman Kemp present the first visit of the week to the One Show studio, featuring the usual mix of topical stories and celebrity chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey takes Lily to school to speak to the headmaster about the bullying but is mortified when she finds out the students have access to her secret cam page. Lola comes home to be greeted by the square who rally round the family for support. Freddie tries to recruit a dream-team for The Vic pub quiz

programme.title: Family Footsteps
programme.desc: With Gavin Andrews as their guide the Quail-Walker family travel further back in time. Teenagers Noah and Fionn hop on a steam train to find out about a family connection to the railways while Grandad Desmond discovers a shocking family secret. In London, Fionn and Noah play cello and viola with a composer cousin they've never met and find out about their family links to The Sound of Music and Frank Sinatra

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: Every year millions of tons of waste are dumped in landfill sites, but how safe are they? Reporter Amber Haque investigates a Staffordshire landfill which residents claim has affected their health and examines the potentially toxic legacy of historic landfill sites

programme.title: Steeltown Murders
programme.desc: With the swabbing operation set in motion, Paul is adamant to corner Sandra Newton's stepfather, a taxi driver who didn't have an alibi on the night of the murders. The headteacher at a local school is still scarred by the tragic events of 30 years ago, and decides to visit Paul and the team to offer her help. In flashbacks to 1973, Paul is still adamant that the police should be connecting Sandra's case to the recent murders. With Keith Allen

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: The Peninsula Nurses
programme.desc: Part one of two. Documentary following the Ards Peninsula district nurses as they care for patients in their own homes. In a busy day, Gemma monitors the blood sugar levels of a retired minister near Donaghadee, while Tanya heads to Portaferry to take pre-chemotherapy blood samples from a cancer patient. As Claire prepares to move to a new team, she pays a final visit to a patient she has looked after for years

programme.title: Have I Got a Bit More News for You
programme.desc: Mel Giedroyc hosts an extended episode of the satirical quiz, with comedian Chris McCausland and broadcaster Kirsty Wark joining team captains Paul Merton and Ian Hislop

programme.title: Glow Up: Britain's Next Make-Up Star
programme.desc: The MUAs work in pairs to create special effects make-up for the BBC show Ghosts for the judging of the show's Hair and Make-up Designer Natalie Pateman. At Glow Up Studios the special effects challenges continue as they have to create a character that represents one of the zodiac signs for guest judge Vanessa Davis. In the Face Off, the bottom two contestants work against the clock to produce a symmetrical crystal embellishment design

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Sally Nugent round-up the national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: The team investigate the scammers using social media accounts to get peoples bank details and one of the biggest phone companies explains how it is tackling spam calls

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: Rav Wilding investigates the noise-detecting cameras being used to tackle anti-social drivers, the importance of fingerprint evidence and how 3D graphics are used in courtrooms

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The Defenders investigate an 800,000 home improvement scam that uses a kitchen extension built by someone else as a fake show home and rescue puppies from an illegal breeder

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Tommy sees potential in a piece of land in Hitchin, Herefordshire while Jacqui looks round a flat in London's Penge. Dion visits a terraced house in Nottingham

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Charlie Ross visits the Ardingly International Antiques Fair, with experts Philip Serrell and Roo Irvine. He also visits a business that conserves historical artifacts

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Scarlett and Ollie have fun pulling pranks as the Mad Badgers and Rosie confides in Al. Luca tries to get Rob to open up while Malika finds herself in a medical emergency

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: JJ Chalmers revamps a vintage suitcase, blacksmith Kev Paxton attempts to transform a metal birdcage and screen printer Zoe Murphy sets to work on a mid 20th-century coffee table

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Ginny Buckley meets a retired couple from a town in Essex who are hoping to find a new home in a village as close to the county's coast as their 475,000 budget will allow

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The sights and sounds of the famous horticultural event

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: Jay Blades and the experts hear the stories of a teddy bear, a set of vintage golf clubs and a wall clock that once hung in a school, before mending the items for their owners

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Alex Jones and Jermaine Jenas present another mix of nationwide reports and live studio-based chat

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Stacey faces the judgemental parents at school but it is the reactions at home she is most worried about and Lola is left feeling low as her speech becomes even more slurred. Rivalries boil over at The Vic quiz and Whitney convinces Chelsea to fix things with Finlay, Felix and Zack

programme.title: Waterloo Road
programme.desc: Kelly Jo's makes a shocking revelation, causing problems for Nicky and her family and Amy finds herself infatuated with a colleague. Kim's day goes from bad to worse after a conversation between her and Lindon is overheard before a meeting with the governors

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: The semi-finals kick off with a visit to Gloucestershire's Fire Service College. Cooking in teams for the first time, the hopefuls have three and a half hours to serve a feast for 120 of the emergency responders and trainers. Back in the studio, they use their creativity to tinned and jarred food into a MasterChef-worthy dish - but for one of them, this will be their final challenge

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Spotlight
programme.desc: Conor Spackman hears testimony from the relatives of the victims in a spate of gun murders in north and west Belfast over the last five years. He examines and investigates links between the killings and a dissident republican group claiming to be on ceasefire

programme.title: Rain Dogs
programme.desc: Selby, Gloria and Lenny go on a road trip in search of Costello after a troubling call from Iris. Some upsetting news pushes Costello to her breaking point and she abandons her dreams to lead an ordinary life for her daughter's sake but the disappointment won't shift and she contemplates a different ending

programme.title: Matt Willis: Fighting Addiction
programme.desc: Bassist and co-founder of Busted Matt Willis opens up about his experiences battling drug and alcohol addiction and his daily struggle to stay clean and sober. He speaks on the constant fear of relapse and the pressure it puts on himself and his family. Matt looks back on his past and his darkest days, trying to get to the root of his addictions. He visits a rehab unit that made a real difference to his recovery to speak with experts about why he and fellow addicts become dependent on drugs and alcohol before travelling to Imperial College London to meet a research team who are studying the differences in the brains of people with addictions and people without

programme.title: Question of Sport
programme.desc: England cricketer Tammy Beaumont, rugby league great Robbie Hunter-Paul, double Paralympic gold medallist Maisie Summers-Newton and former Bolton Wanderers footballer Fabrice Muamba join team captains Ugo Monye and Sam Quek and host Paddy McGuinness on the quiz

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Jon Kay and Nina Warhurst round-up the national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features

programme.title: Rip Off Britain
programme.desc: Angela, Gloria and Julia tackle the appliance cover policies that aren't worth a penny and the trade finder website that doesn't do the checks it should. Plus, smart meter advice

programme.title: Frontline Fightback
programme.desc: How one cyclist uses social media to recover stolen bikes. Plus, how police are using body heat sensors to prevent robberies from trades people's vans

programme.title: Defenders UK
programme.desc: The Defenders uncover a human trafficking and modern slavery operation in a Bristol car wash and investigate the illegal selling of deadly diet pills on the dark web

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Dion Dublin heads to his old stomping ground, near Stratford-upon-Avon, to see an intriguing lot consisting of 16 garages. Tommy Walsh is in Wolverhampton looking at a three-bedroom detached property, and Martel Maxwell is in Sunderland where a four-bedroom mid-terrace has a bit of a damp problem

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Stephanie Connell and Philip Serrell help teams search for items at the Peterborough Festival of Antiques, while Eric Knowles views a horseshoe collection at Oakham Castle, Rutland

programme.title: BBC News at One; Weather
programme.desc: A round-up of the latest headlines

programme.title: Doctors
programme.desc: Bear's encounter with the police takes an unexpected turn and Scarlett and Ollie's latest prank takes a wrong turn. Zara and Emma help a woman confront a care home

programme.title: Money for Nothing
programme.desc: Sarah visits Witley recycling centre in Surrey where she finds an Edwardian armchair, a dated display cabinet and a collection of costume jewellery for her and the team to upcycle

programme.title: Escape to the Country
programme.desc: Margherita Taylor meets a pregnant couple who are returning to the UK after seven years in Switzerland and looking for a family home in Cambridgeshire. Away from the search, Margherita also visits one of the country's largest solar farms to learn how generating renewable energy can be compatible with grazing livestock

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The sights and sounds of the famous horticultural event

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: The artisans team up to restore a reclining armchair and a frog-shaped clock, while leather expert Suzie Fletcher is right at home reviving a tired old saddler's stitching stool

programme.title: Pointless
programme.desc: Quiz in which contestants try to score the fewest points possible by giving the least obvious correct answers to questions. Presented by Alexander Armstrong, with Stephen Mangan

programme.title: BBC News at Six; Weather
programme.desc: The latest headlines

programme.title: RHS Chelsea Flower Show
programme.desc: The sights and sounds of the famous horticultural event

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: Ben struggles to accept Lola's prognosis and accuses the family of accepting it too easily, after a heart to heart with Phil he starts to see the error in his ways. Tensions in the Slater household continue to rise and Freddie receives an ADHD referral. Plus, there is a glimmer of hope for Chelsea and Ravi's relationship

programme.title: The Repair Shop
programme.desc: A Gloucestershire woman brings in her King Charles II painting, hoping Lucia Scalisi can restore it to its crowning glory, and silversmith Brenton West works on a well-travelled trunk, which holds cherished memories for a mother and daughter. Goldsmith Richard Talman tries to reunite the broken pieces of an engagement ring and toy restorers Julie and Amanda revive a toy donkey that comforted a young child after he lost his mother and his sister

programme.title: The Great British Sewing Bee
programme.desc: Sara Pascoe, Patrick Grant and Esme Young welcome 12 new sewers to the competition in Leeds. For their first pattern challenge, the sewers make a top with a twist at its centre to give them a straightforward construction task with an added brain teaser. In the transformation task the competitors take the traditional 'office uniform' of a pencil skirt and a blouse and make it reflect their own style. Finally in the made-to-measure challenge, the contestants try to perfectly fit a dress with cut-out details

programme.title: BBC News at Ten
programme.desc: A round-up of today's headlines

programme.title: Nolan Live
programme.desc: Stephen Nolan probes the issues that matter to the people of Northern Ireland, focusing on the stories of the week and the people making the headlines in lively debates, with viewers sending in their questions via text, email and tweet

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Mikey makes a decision that sends shockwaves through the masseria, and leaves many of the residents questioning the seriousness of each other's matches. Dannii Minogue gathers the boys for their first Chemistry Test to couples discover what brings them together and what moves them apart

programme.title: I Kissed a Boy
programme.desc: Dannii Minogue shakes things up by welcoming three single men into the masseria, to see if some of the couples who have matched up are as devoted as they appear. While the new arrivals throw some serious moves at the party, Josh takes a break to reveal something important to Mikey before the boys all weigh up their options for the second Kiss-Off

Even DS Maddox isn't getting on Hathaway's nerves quite as much, so this rejuvenated trio sets out to discover who murdered American classics student Rose Anderson, whose body has been hauled from the canal with neck and abdomen wounds. Nevertheless, a few red herrings threaten to get in their way of landing the killer. Kevin Whately, Laurence Fox and Angela Griffin star

Thriller, starring Robson Green, with Simone Lahbib and Mark Letheren

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

programme.title: Licence to Kill (1989)
programme.desc: While on leave to attend the wedding of his friend, CIA agent Felix Leiter, James Bond is asked to help with a secret mission to capture notorious drug baron, Franz Sanchez. Though successful, Sanchez later escapes and seeks revenge on Leiter, killing his new bride and leaving Leiter for dead. Incensed by this, Bond refuses his next mission from MI6 to go in search of Sanchez, leaving M with no alternative but to revoke Bond's licence to kill. Now considered a rogue agent, Bond goes undercover to pose as an assassin for hire within Sanchez's drug empire, to bring him down from the inside. Spy thriller, starring Timothy Dalton, Robert Davi, Carey Lowell, Talisa Soto and Benicio Del Toro

Fast forward two years and the sisters are back to find out if the couple are now marching to the same beat and living their shared dream. programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics
