In the first episode, Reeva's parents Barry and June Steenkamp discuss her early life as they face fresh grief from the news that a parole process will put them in contact with Pistorius

programme.title: Taskmaster

At this stage of the competition, it's no surprise that people find retrieving pineapples from a millpond stressful. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In
programme.desc: Joe Lycett explores how to get the most out of a weekend away with a fun-packed, 48-hour itinerary of trademark humour and facts. This time, fellow comedian Sarah Millican joins him for an exploration of the Lithuanian capital Vilnius. The duo take to the skies to see the city from above - an experience they find by turns terrifying, thrilling and beautiful. Keen to explore Lithuanian cuisine, they sample cold beetroot soup and cepelini dumplings washed down with gira, a drink made from fermented beer. Later, the pair explore Vilnius' medieval centre on foot, taking in Gediminas's tower and Lukiskes Prison

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows interior designer Kathryn Tyler as she tries to create a Scandinavian-style eco house in her mother's back garden in Falmouth, Cornwall, close by the Lizard Peninsula. The plan is ambitious, featuring a white-painted brick ground floor, a lightweight timber-frame first floor and cleverly designed spaces, but the small size of the plot and Kathryn's inexperience could hamper the project

programme.title: The Dog House

Toy poodle Gizmo tries to overcome his social anxieties to win the hearts of Fiona and Maisie, a mother and daughter coming to terms with their future separation, and a lurcher with a broken tail requires lots of care - and with any luck, a forever home

programme.title: Travel Man: 48 Hours In

When visitors scan the code, the statue phones them, so Joe and Mawaan get to hear from Oscar Wilde and Molly Malone. After exploring the city's smallest restaurant, they head to its largest tourist attraction, the Guinness Storehouse, where they learn how to pour the perfect pint and even get their faces printed on it. Day two begins with a swim at Forty Foot, then at Windmill Lane studios the duo learn the story of Ireland's answer to Abbey Road and lay down a track of their own

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay heads for Pasadena, California, where he visits Jamaican-themed restaurant Cafe Kingston. The business in run by Dr Una Morris, a micro-managing owner who also works at a radiotherapy clinic next door, and is determined to introduce hospital-style techniques to the kitchen by sealing everything in plastic bags

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Three couples from in and around Rugby, Warwickshire, compete in the challenge. Laid-back estate agent Michael and his partner Caroline cook a fine dining menu, but party queens Soroya and Jodie aren't impressed with the main. Expectations are high that Freddie and Raj will produce a fantastic menu, but Michael and Caroline are looking for cracks in their perfect relationship. On the final night, Soroya and Jodie are determined to show their guests what they're all about - but things fail to go according to plan

programme.title: Moneybags
programme.desc: Contestants face a series of questions with the answers on moneybags that pass along a conveyor belt in front of them. programme.title: The King of Queens
programme.desc: Doug and Carrie decide to try for a baby - but with Arthur under their feet, finding time alone proves difficult. The delivery driver keeps the old man occupied by hiring a dog walker to listen to his stories about the Second World War. Comedy, starring Kevin James

programme.desc: Roz prepares to leave the radio station - but not before airing her views about Frasier's relationship with Julia. Meanwhile, Niles and Daphne take the plunge and decide to start a family

programme.desc: Julia attends a party with Frasier, where she manages to offend the entire Crane family by blurting out the news that Daphne is pregnant. Comedy, guest starring Felicity Hunter, with Kelsey Grammer

programme.desc: In Yorkshire, three couples compete to host the best dinner party. Sheffield pair Javvina and Tyrone kick off the competition with an international menu. Their food receives mixed reviews from married couple Chantell and Lisa, while Lisa struggles to finish the spicy Malaysian starter. Foodie couple Jake and Emily prove hard to please, and Lisa isn't impressed by Jake's excitable antics at the dinner table. On day two Jake and Emily cook up a fine-dining menu. Finally, party-lovers Chantell and Lisa have a stressful day of prep as they vie for the 1,000 prize

programme.desc: Mother-and-son estate agents Sharon and Shaun Garner help Portsmouth pair Colin and Tracy find their perfect property in Almera. With 16 years' experience, it should be plain sailing for the Garners - until they discover that Tracy was also an estate agent. So with everything to prove the pressure is on to deliver the dream. Meanwhile, in Mlaga, Surrey-based fitness fan Faiz searches for a holiday home in Duquesa

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Karen and Richard have a large budget but no luck when it comes to making a deal, so they enlist the help of Kirstie Allsopp in their search for a family home in the West Midlands. Having already sold up in London, the pair are desperate to settle down with their three children but Kirstie thinks it might be their very specific wish list that is the problem. Camilla and Liam are struggling to keep up with the fast-moving market and can rarely book viewings before properties are sold so they ask Phil Spencer to help them in their search for a property to start a family in. With Nurse Camilla often working nightshifts, the pair are struggling to fit in some house hunting, after some time with Phil there are two contenders but some quick decisions must be made to avoid losing out yet again

programme.title: Kids
programme.desc: As they approach adulthood, Havana and Kane try to make sense of their pasts. Sixteen-year-old Havana no longer sees her mum and has never known her dad but with help from the service she hopes to find her father. After spending his childhood in multiple foster placements and children's homes, Kane returns to Coventry to be near his mum but wants to understand why he was taken into care in the first place

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson meets 34-year-old Skyla from Kent who runs her own cleaning business and is looking for Mr Right. Zeus, a 27-year-old trans man from Norwich, is new to the dating scene and is looking for someone special to go on this journey with him

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Thirty four-year-old Dan, a construction manager from Essex putting a broken engagement behind him. He is partnered with 35-year-old Jess, a personal trainer whose love life is in need of a good workout. Twenty-five-year-old Emily from Leeds boasts a master's degree in law. Her date is rom-com-loving Yorkshire lad Ryan. Carpet salesman Nathan, 28, has been round the block and back again in his home town of Burnley. But he is here to turn over a new leaf. His date is retail assistant Chloe, 23, a Lancashire woman who hates a pushover and is looking for a man to challenge her

programme.title: My Name Is Reeva

Emergency nurse practitioner Alison is on a busy shift, while explaining how her parents' life in Iran, and the struggles they faced during the revolution, influenced her to get into medicine

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets

With the help of his dad Michael, the project is supposed to be a chance to spend quality time together outside of work but the stress begins to ramp up when the five-tonne car lift Tim ordered from China doesn't fit into the specially prepared hole in the basement. Plus, Kevin and Natasha revisit Jitinder, whose house was unfinished due to the moisture problems and his resin floor last time they met, now they experience the full splendour of his Hollywood Hills style home

programme.title: Walking Britain's Lost Railways
programme.desc: Until it closed in 1966 the Deeside Railway followed the River Dee upstream from Aberdeen into what is now the Cairngorms National Park. As luck would have it, Queen Victoria purchased Balmoral just as the line was set to open, giving the route prestige. Rob Bell retraces the route, visiting a shooting estate, tossing a caber and finding an unmistakable Highland 'brand' that all owe their existence to this royal railway age. He also explores a quiet valley of cattle farming and timber sawmills, and, in truth, a simple railway that struggled for decades to justify its own existence, despite its royal veneer

programme.desc: The presenter and antiques expert Rachel Holland face off in a midweek duel in Stourbridge. Their first challenge sees them in Stourbridge Town Hall, offering valuations to locals and snapping up the pieces they reckon will make a profit in the sale room. Will the auctioneers take a chance on an early 20th century stained glass window, or a copper-topped tavern table? Later, Paul and Rachel have the opportunity to nab a high-value lot to put under the hammer in their Jackpot Duel

programme.title: 5 News at 5
programme.desc: Round-up of the day's headlines from around the world

programme.title: Eggheads
programme.desc: 'Midlife Crisis' take on the regular team. The team are all friends or neighbours of team captain Neil. Neil and Jimmy met during the filming of another quiz show (15-1) and have remained good friends. They participate in local quiz league The Hampton Quiz League

programme.title: 5 News Update

programme.title: Jane McDonald: My Yorkshire
programme.desc: Jane takes in the delights of Oakworth, the station featured in classic film The Railway Children, and meets Christopher Witty, who played Jim in the movie. As Jane Eyre is one of her favourite novels, Jane visits Haworth to learn more about the Bronte sisters' lives and the inspirational landscape of West Yorkshire

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: Ambulance: Code Red
programme.desc: Midlands Air Ambulance and the critical care team are sent to save a tree surgeon who has impaled himself after falling 12 feet onto metal railings, possibly paralysing himself. Elsewhere, a motorcyclist is thrown from his bike and has to crawl across three lanes of traffic

programme.title: 5 News Update
programme.desc: The latest reports

programme.title: 999: Critical Condition
programme.desc: The pressure is on for Dr Jamil Aslam when 64 year-old Barry is rushed into resus with suspected sepsis. Lucy is rushed into the Emergency department after her horse somersaulted while she was riding it, catapulting her to the ground and landing on top of her. Trauma Team Leader Paul Hancock fears she may never walk again. Ena is rushed in for emergency surgery to remove her bladder as it is riddled with cancer and 78 year-old Alan has a compound fracture. Student Paramedic Ethan is rushed in to the Emergency Department after being involved in an accident on the way home from work

programme.title: Casualty 24/7: Every Second Counts
programme.desc: A mini-heatwave results in an influx of patients at Barnsley Hospital. 50-year-old Mark is rushed into the emergency department after an accident involving a garden shredder, while three-year-old Ophelia is brought in by her dad after a mishap with a sun cream bottle. Elsewhere, doctors treat 64-year-old Melvin, who suffers from the incurable lung condition COPD, and 27-year-old Jack is assessed after collapsing at work

programme.title: A&E After Dark
programme.desc: The night shift staff treat an elderly pedestrian who has been run over by a motorcycle. A CT scan reveals broken ribs, a bleed in the brain, and a broken shoulder

programme.title: Criminals: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Nick Wallis presents highlights from the fourth series, including the nail-biting moment a lorry driver halted a car whose driver had collapsed

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home

programme.title: Inside the Tower of London
programme.desc: The latest recruit to join the team of 37 beefeaters begins his career with some testing exams. Chris must learn the extensive history of the Tower by heart, a word-for-word knowledge which he will be tested on by the governor before being let loose alone on the 100,000 visitors who come to the Tower every week. Plus, chief curator Tracy Borman turns her attention to the time of Henry VIII, when the Tower gained its notorious reputation for imprisonment and execution, revealing the history of Anne Boleyn within the walls

programme.title: GPs: Behind Closed Doors
programme.desc: The medics explore the theory that a 'broken heart' can cause patients to suffer very real mental and physical problems. Dr Wyne chats to Adolphus, who is struggling to come to terms with the recent death of his wife and best friend within a few weeks of each other. Dr Qamar pays a home visit to Elsie, a sprightly octogenarian whose health has deteriorated since the death of her husband, while Dr Razak treats young Emily, who has inherited a rare genetic condition from her late father which weakens the muscles of the heart

programme.title: Wildlife SOS
programme.desc: The work of volunteers treating sick, injured and orphaned animals at a wildlife sanctuary

programme.title: Great Artists
programme.desc: Art historian Tim Marlow profiles influential painter JMW Turner, who divided the critics with his rapid brush-strokes, treatment of light and tendency toward abstraction, but is now hailed as one of the great British artists

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: Monkey visits Edinburgh, Scotland's capital city, where he learns about traditional Scottish clothing and music

programme.title: Milkshake! Monkey's Amazing Adventures
programme.desc: Monkey visits Edinburgh, Scotland's capital city, where he learns about traditional Scottish clothing and music

programme.title: Pip and Posy
programme.desc: Pip, Posy and Zac are having fun playing in the snow and try to persuade Frankie to join them

programme.title: Thomas & Friends
programme.desc: Thomas is surprised when an elephant comes to his rescue when he ends up derailed in a paddy field while working on the Indian railway

programme.title: Getting Personal
programme.desc: Getting Personal is an interview programme in which presenter Deepa Shastri meets Richard D France, a poet, writer and a mental health campaigner

programme.title: Hatari! (1962)
programme.desc: A group of reckless animal trappers travels through the wilds of Africa, but the arrival of a beautiful photographer looks set to cause upheaval among the group. Comedy adventure, starring John Wayne, Red Buttons, Hardy Kruger, Elsa Martinelli and Michele Girardon

programme.title: Comanche Station (1960)
programme.desc: A cowboy recruits a trio of outlaws to rescue a woman held captive at a Comanche camp and reunite her with her husband in return for a large reward. However, his partners decide the bounty should be split three ways rather than four and plan to double-cross him. Western, starring Randolph Scott, Nancy Gates, Claude Akins and Skip Homeier

programme.title: Tora! Tora! Tora! (1970)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama recounting the bombing of Pearl Harbour from both the Japanese and American perspectives, reconstructing the events leading up to the devastating attack on the US naval base in 1941. Starring Martin Balsam, So Yamamura, Joseph Cotten, James Whitmore and Jason Robards

programme.title: Star Trek (2009)
programme.desc: The trainee crew members of the starship Enterprise embark on their maiden flight, which pits them against a Romulan commander from the future who is planning a horrific revenge on those he blames for a tragedy in his own time. Sci-fi adventure based on the original TV series, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto, Eric Bana, Zoe Saldana and Leonard Nimoy

programme.title: Independence Day (1996)
programme.desc: A fleet of huge flying saucers launches a devastating and unprovoked attack on Earth. As survivors try to flee the seemingly unstoppable alien invaders, the courageous US president, an ace pilot and a computer genius come up with a plan to take the fight to the enemy and save the human race. Roland Emmerich's sci-fi adventure, starring Will Smith, Bill Pullman, Jeff Goldblum, Mary McDonnell, Randy Quaid, Robert Loggia and Harry Connick Jr

programme.title: The Craft (1996)
programme.desc: A new girl who finds it difficult to fit in at school befriends three goth misfits, who discover they can perform magic and form a secret coven. They initially use their powers for self-improvement, but eventually start to turn against their classmates, driving the ringleader insane as her lust for power takes over. Horror, starring Robin Tunney, Fairuza Balk, Neve Campbell, Rachel True and Skeet Ulrich

programme.title: Book Club (2018)
programme.desc: Four lifelong friends aim to spice up their mundane routines by reading the provocative bestseller Fifty Shades of Grey in their monthly book club. With newfound confidence, they each begin to come alive as exciting romances are ignited and old flames are rekindled. Comedy drama, starring Diane Keaton and Jane Fonda

programme.title: The Wrong Box (1966)
programme.desc: Two elderly brothers each stand to inherit a fortune if the other dies first - but one of them is not prepared to leave anything to chance, and begins a series of disastrous attempts on his unsuspecting sibling's life. However, when one of the pair appears to have really died, his nephews conspire to cover it up. Black comedy, with John Mills, Ralph Richardson, Michael Caine, Peter Cook and Dudley Moore

programme.title: First Men in the Moon (1964)
programme.desc: An eccentric Victorian inventor discovers a strange material that defies gravity and uses it to build the world's first spaceship. Leading an expedition to the moon, he is astonished to discover it is inhabited by giant ants and caterpillar-like creatures. Sci-fi adventure based on HG Wells' novel, starring Lionel Jeffries, Edward Judd, Martha Hyer and Miles Malleson, with special effects by Ray Harryhausen

programme.title: The Cockleshell Heroes (1955)
programme.desc: Fact-based Second World War drama in which eight British Marines carry out a daring operation to canoe into Bordeaux harbour, where they plan to sabotage the German fleet - a mission considered by many to be suicidal. Directed by and starring Jose Ferrer. With Trevor Howard, Dora Bryan and Anthony Newley

programme.title: The Guns of Fort Petticoat (1957)
programme.desc: A lieutenant deserts after his commanding officer launches an unprovoked attack on a Comanche village during the Civil War. Realising that there are no soldiers in his home town to protect it from reprisals, he returns to train the local women to defend themselves. Western, starring Audie Murphy, Kathryn Grant, Hope Emerson and Jeff Donnell

programme.title: Sister Act (1992)
programme.desc: Nightclub singer Deloris Van Cartier agrees to testify against her gangster boyfriend after witnessing a murder. Placed in protective custody by the authorities, she is less than pleased to discover she is expected to pose as chaste nun Sister Mary Clarence in a convent. Comedy, starring Whoopi Goldberg, Harvey Keitel, Maggie Smith, Bill Nunn and Kathy Najimy

programme.title: Alien: Covenant (2017)
programme.desc: A crew of colonists sent to populate an alien planet have their mission diverted by a mysterious signal. After landing on a nearby world, they discover what became of the ill-fated Prometheus mission. Ridley Scott's sci-fi thriller, starring Katherine Waterston, Michael Fassbender and Danny McBride

programme.title: The Craft: Legacy (2020)
programme.desc: Three girls, Frankie, Tabby, and Lourdes, attempt to freeze time with magic, but they require a fourth member. When Lily Schechner moves into the town with her therapist mother, the newcomer's special powers make her perfect for their coven. Sequel to 1996 horror drama The Craft, starring Cailee Spaeny, Gideon Adlon, Lovie Simone and Zoey Luna

programme.title: Joy (2015)
programme.desc: An imaginative youngster with dreams of being an inventor grows up to be a downtrodden single mother, struggling to support her chaotic family. She sees a chance to turn all their lives around when inspiration strikes and she creates a new household tool, but faces the challenge of selling her product in the demanding world of a home shopping TV station. Fact-based drama, starring Jennifer Lawrence, Robert De Niro and Bradley Cooper

programme.title: Timberjack (1954)
programme.desc: A man forced to return to his Montana home to take over the family lumber business sets out to discover the reasons behind his father's death, while engaging in a fierce professional and romantic rivalry with a neighbouring forester. Western, starring Sterling Hayden, David Brian, Vera Ralston and Hoagy Carmichael

programme.title: To Hell and Back (1955)
programme.desc: Biopic of actor Audie Murphy, following his service in the Second World War. Enlisting in the Army as a teenager to support his younger siblings, he excelled himself in action in the conflict in Europe and became one of America's most decorated soldiers. Starring Murphy as himself alongside Marshall Thompson, Charles Drake and Gregg Palmer

programme.title: Tomahawk (1951)
programme.desc: Frontier scout Jim Bridger doesn't approve when a gold rush leads the US army to build a fort on land occupied by the Sioux. The situation goes from bad to worse when a sadistic officer launches an unprovoked attack, prompting a vengeful tribe to go on the offensive and leaving Bridger the only one who can save the soldiers at the fort from certain death. Western, starring Van Heflin, Yvonne de Carlo and Alex Nicol, and featuring an early appearance by Rock Hudson

programme.title: High Noon (1952)
programme.desc: A town marshal is torn between love and duty on his wedding day as he prepares for the arrival of a vengeful adversary on the midday train. Meanwhile, the townsfolk the marshal has so loyally protected are certain he will be killed in the confrontation and abandon him one by one to face his enemy alone. Western, starring Gary Cooper, Grace Kelly, Lloyd Bridges and Lee Van Cleef

programme.title: Star Trek Into Darkness (2013)
programme.desc: Captain Kirk and the crew of the starship Enterprise are sent on a clandestine mission into enemy territory to track down the rogue Starfleet agent behind a terrorist attack on Earth. However, the assignment brings to light a hidden threat from within their own organisation. Sci-fi adventure sequel, starring Chris Pine, Zachary Quinto and Benedict Cumberbatch

programme.title: Men in Black (1997)
programme.desc: A streetwise cop is enlisted by a top-secret government force dedicated to policing alien visitors to Earth, teaming up with a veteran agent just as a body-swapping extraterrestrial giant insect begins a reign of terror throughout New York City. Sci-fi comedy, starring Will Smith, Tommy Lee Jones, Linda Fiorentino, Rip Torn and Vincent D'Onofrio

programme.title: Fight Club (1999)
programme.desc: A disillusioned office worker grows weary of his humdrum existence, but after meeting the mysterious Tyler Durden he finds fulfilment in establishing a club where similarly frustrated men come to vent their anger in bouts of bare-knuckle fighting. Satirical drama, directed by David Fincher, starring Edward Norton, Brad Pitt, Helena Bonham Carter, Meat Loaf and Jared Leto

programme.title: American Gigolo (1980)
programme.desc: A male escort is falsely accused of murdering a wealthy woman, and his only hope of proving his innocence rests with a client reluctant to come forward and provide him with an alibi. Thriller, written and directed by Paul Schrader, starring Richard Gere, Lauren Hutton and Hector Elizondo

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: At The Dog, James and Ste's stag do celebrations are underway, but when the games start things become tense as James fails to get any questions right about his fiance

programme.title: Hollyoaks
programme.desc: Ste opens up to James about his concerns that the marriage will change them, and the pair come up with a plan to prove their love for each other

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA

Alan gets a wake-up call from internet critics, who he believes are trying to shut him down

programme.desc: Chef Gordon Ramsay visits family-run Luigi's in Orange County, California, where lazy shortcuts following the retirement of the owner's father have led the business to suffer. Ramsay faces the daunting task of reuniting a feuding family, before turning around the struggling restaurant, which currently has 126 dishes on the menu

programme.title: The Neighborhood

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Mitch and Cameron head to the streets to take part in some last-minute campaigning as election day arrives, while Claire regrets agreeing to do interviews. American comedy, starring Jesse Tyler Ferguson and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Cameron's dad comes to visit, but an argument over dinner leads to an awkward situation, and Luke discovers his elderly friend Walt has died. Meanwhile, Phil and Alex share some father-daughter bonding time, and Haley takes advantage of her parents' distractions and throws a party

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: The squad springs into action when Jake and Amy's wedding is jeopardised by a major threat. Holt is reluctant to open the email saying whether he has been appointed Commissioner

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Penny buys Leonard and Sheldon some Star Trek action figures, but the duo refuse to remove them from the packaging in case their value is diminished. programme.desc: Howard is put in charge of looking after Stephen Hawking's wheelchair when the famous scientist comes to lecture at the university for a week - and takes advantage of his position to blackmail Sheldon into performing assorted unpleasant tasks. Guest starring Stephen Hawking

programme.desc: Sheldon is flattered when a graduate student takes a shine to him, but she thinks his social life is distracting him from his work and removes him from his limited circle of friends by forcing him to work on a troublesome scientific problem. Guest starring Riki Lindhome

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Dinner reservations have been secured at a plush restaurant, but Gloria is taking forever to get ready and an almighty sartorial crisis strikes when Mitch and Cam don the exact same outfit. Meanwhile, the Dunphys can't decide whether Luke is trustworthy enough to be left home alone. Starring Ed O'Neill and Julie Bowen

programme.title: Modern Family
programme.desc: Manny is not happy when Gloria hires a male nanny and it turns out Jay isn't that keen either. Phil is worried about his dad Frank, and embarks on a mission to help him get his groove back, while Pepper pops by to plan Mitch and Cam's wedding, but when talk turns to unicorns, the pair attempt to rein their pal in. Nathan Lane guest stars

programme.title: Brooklyn Nine-Nine
programme.desc: A visitor from Latvia causes Boyle and Peralta to begin investigating Nikolaj's family. Captain Holt and Santiago bring in famed forensic scientist Dr Yee to help close a difficult murder case for Diaz

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Cumbria, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien visit collector Paula, who badly needs some cash to fix her leaking roof. Henry picks a Morris Minor for restoration, while Simon turns some unwanted wood into furniture that seriously impresses independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: Investigating the case of a champion cat-breeder, and the grandsons of a Bristol man follow a trail that leads them to a secret about chemical weapons testing

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: A company takes on the case of an ex-mayor of Wokingham, and uncovers his devotion to the local community. Plus, the story of a Jewish child's evacuation from Nazi Germany, and details of unclaimed estates where heirs are still to be found

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition begins at stately home Anstey Hall in Cambridge, with father and son team John and Johnny de Bruyne. The fun starts with a character-revealing afternoon of goose-herding, before the participants dress to impress at a formal dinner. John recounts stories of royal connections - which fails to impress hotel managers Mark and Layla. In the morning, as they tuck in to a self-service breakfast, guest Tim decides that DIY doesn't work at Anstey Hall, but when he notes this on his feedback form, John and Johnny accuse him of game-playing

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit of the competition is to clothes-free Clover Spa and Hotel in Birmingham, where owner Tim Higgs hopes to convert his rivals to the joys of naturism. Judging with an extra critical eye are John and Jonny De Bruyne, who received negative feedback from Tim, and a thorough room inspection reveals a dusty porn DVD. Tim tries to encourage his nervous guests to take part in a naked spa experience, but John opts to watch television instead. When feedback is invited, Tim is delighted to discover Mark and Layla would stay again but shocked by the 'porn film' discovery

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to the Angel Hotel in Coleford, Gloucestershire for the third day of the competition, where a treasure hunt organised by hosts Mark and Layla brings out their guests' competitive sides. Meanwhile, there is confusion at breakfast and Layla's manners are criticised

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The final stay is at Higher Gitcombe in Totnes, Devon, where owners Paul and Lynnie Jolly set out to spoil their guests. Everyone is overwhelmed by the added extras, but naturist Tim is put off by cushions and clutter. After a masterclass in Nordic walking, Lynnie serves up a veg smoothie, which unhealthy eaters Mark and Layla dubiously down in one. Over dinner, Tim challenges his host's organic 'niche'. And Layla, still smarting from his negative feedback, labels him 'weird, naked Tim'. At breakfast, guests are wary as Tim's order goes wrong and Jonny and Layla engage in an eating competition. When feedback is invited, the Jollys are affronted by accusations of special treatment and vow to put the record straight

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: On the final day of the competition, the owners of Anstey Hall, the Clover Spa and Hotel, the Angel Hotel and Higher Gitcombe meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Having aired their issues, the winners are announced

programme.title: A Lake District Farm Shop
programme.desc: Documentary following a family-run shop in the Lake District and the local people who produce its goods. The first episode features a ramen chef who hopes the shop's managers will stock his new recipe. A baker looks to the landscape for inspiration in making bread, and a butcher heads to the fells to hand-pick the Herdwick Lambs to be sold on his counter

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Stephanie gets green-fingered as she sets out to restore the chateau's original greenhouse, which has recently been damaged in a storm. Lee and Belinda continue to expand their new outdoor venue. When their first wedding falls through, they fortunately get a new booking for a 60th birthday, but then end up in a race against time to get the garden party ready. With 12 acres of land to enjoy, Dick and Angel make sure their Wellington boots have a home, creating bootjacks for the newly renovated boot room

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud returns to follow more home-design projects. Rob Hodgson and Kay Ralph plan to build a sleek glass-fronted house on a crumbling clifftop in Gwynedd, taking inspiration from the villas of California. However, access will be extremely difficult and expensive because of a low bridge over the narrow track to the site, and problems arise when one of the heaviest storms in recent history batters the coast. To make matters worse, erosion specialists predict the property could fall into the sea within just 60 years and the pair are prohibited from reinforcing the cliff face

programme.title: Car S.O.S.
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend head to Rochdale to rescue an Opel Manta GTE. The car belongs to former amateur rally driver Alan, who loved his Manta so much he couldn't bear to part with it, even when it went off the road. With Alan becoming a bit of a recluse after developing health problems and losing his wife to cancer, his family and friends hope that the Car S.O.S treatment will be just the thing to bring Alan back out of his shell

programme.title: Inside Rolls-Royce
programme.desc: A behind-the-scenes look at the exclusive and luxurious world of the renowned British car brand, following workers at the manufacturer's Goodwood factory as they build their most expensive bespoke car to date, the Celestial Phantom, which comes complete with diamond-studded interior. The programme reveals the craftsmanship that goes into making and selling vehicles with a huge price tag and the lengths to which the team will go in the pursuit of perfection

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-one-year-old Mark is brought in after coming off his bike and doctors are concerned he may have suffered life-changing damage to his spine, with wife Karen rushing to be by his side. Ten-year-old Aiden comes to paediatrics with his mum and her girlfriend Lorraine, after hurting his foot on the monkey bars at school

programme.title: Shocking Emergency Calls
programme.desc: Emergency services in Stamford, Connecticut, tell the horrific story of how Travis the chimpanzee became the centre of a shocking and brutal attack that would change lives for ever

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jon Richardson and Sean Lock face off once again in another unpredictable battle of words and numbers, with help from Kevin Bridges and Rebecca Front. Rachel Riley is on maths-and-letters duty, and Joe Lycett is in Dictionary Corner with Susie Dent

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Fifty-one-year-old Mark is brought in after coming off his bike and doctors are concerned he may have suffered life-changing damage to his spine, with wife Karen rushing to be by his side. Ten-year-old Aiden comes to paediatrics with his mum and her girlfriend Lorraine, after hurting his foot on the monkey bars at school

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Dorothy Pinkett wants a bolthole where she can escape to on her favourite island of Menorca. For the past seven years she has been caring for her husband, who is disabled after having a stroke. Owning a holiday home that can provide some respite for herself and his wonderful team of carers is really important, so the pressure is really on for Jasmine Harman to deliver the perfect property for her budget of 135,000

programme.title: Kirstie's Vintage Gems
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp helps Amber and Colin turn their bedroom into a dream vintage haven. After an initial assessment, the presenter begins by getting rid of any mass-produced furniture

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jo and Darrell from south-west London are looking for a holiday home on the Balearic Island of Menorca to enjoy with their two young children and Darrell's grown-up son. They run their own busy human resources company together so cannot wait to find a bolthole to relax in and have some quality time as a family. With a budget of 300,000 Danni Menzies is on hand to show them five properties around the south of the island

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Foodies from Brighton are left high and dry on the opening night of their cheese and wine bar, and there's an unwelcome infestation for glampsite owners in Portugal

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Suffolk, Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien meet former agony aunt Janet, whose garden shed is crammed with goodies. With no motors to unearth, Henry makes a rare furniture discovery, while Simon finds a vintage tram bench

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: On the Isle of Wight, Henry Cole finds an unusual three-wheeled motorbike and Simon O'Brien unearths an old projector screen that he wants to turn into a work of art

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers try to establish the value of a Lincolnshire railway man's estate by visiting his last known address, and uncover the story of his military service in Aden, Yemen. Meanwhile, another case is complicated by a family's numerous name changes. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates are divulged

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The probate researchers are on the rock in Ireland, searching for the beneficiaries to the estate of a Limerick-born man. Another case reveals the compulsive hoarding habits of a car enthusiast, and uncovers a potentially highly valuable collection of Dinky toys. Meanwhile, the work of the team brings about an emotional family reunion

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Four sets of campsite proprietors battle it out to be named best value, with the competition beginning at Amber's Bell Tent Camping in Mannington, Norfolk, a retro-styled pre-erected campsite where artistic host Amber Wykes challenges her guests to go native with a series of bushcraft trials. Over dinner, guests Derek and Julie's opinions on glamping irritate both Amber, and glampsite owners Nick and Sheila. Then back at the tents, brother-and-sister team Russell and Jane aren't too impressed with the sleeping arrangements. In the morning, the self-catering breakfast leads to complaints aimed squarely at Amber

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second day of the competition is at Park Farm Camping and Caravan Site in Norfolk, where husband and wife team Derek and Julie Nice are proud to show off their budget, family-friendly site. Former marksman Derek treats his guests to a spot of clay pigeon shooting, bringing out his competitive side

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to 500-year-old Layer Marney Tower in Essex for the third day of the competition, where they are welcomed into luxury glamping lodges by Nick and Sheila Charrington. The guests have little to complain about with the accommodation, but a revelation over dinner changes how they see things. Plus, a treasure hunt organised by the hosts sends one team on a wild goose chase

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Day four is at the Foxhunter Park in Kent, where brother and sister Jane Stacey and Russell Saunders own a caravan site that includes a bistro and entertainment. The accommodation is luxurious but the large scale of the site does not sit well with the campers - and the evening entertainment of a fire-eating limbo dancer leaves most of them cold

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The campers meet for the final time to find out what they thought one another's stay was worth. Amber is offended by Derek's low scoring, while he is thrown by Nick and Sheila's feedback. Russell and Jane have an axe to grind with Derek whose low scoring of their park is made worse by what they see as a personal attack on their hosting, while Nick and Sheila appear to emerge relatively unscathed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Three family teams compete in Glasgow, where highlights include African and Iranian dishes, and a chef's recollections of the time he spent on the road with various rock stars

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Stephanie has a month to convert her old stable into a studio for the launch of her art weekends, but when she doesn't see eye to eye with mother Isobel about the design, renovations could take longer than anticipated. Belinda's promised a heated outdoor swimming pool on the chateau's website, so Lee starts constructing a solar panel system. Dick saves cash by getting creative on a new lighting project for Angel's treasury

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud meets Tamayo Hussey, who has missed Japan since she moved to the UK 14 years earlier with her husband, quantum physics professor Nigel. The couple want to transform a 1960s forester's lodge into a unique Japanese house, complete with a tatami room - decorated in her homeland's traditional style - sliding paper walls and a bath on the roof. Keen to keep costs down, they have decided to engage only the design skills - rather than the full services - of an architect, so with no previous building experience they tackle the project alone

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three boys are admitted for very different reasons, including cyclist Ollie, who arrives with head, neck and facial injuries having been involved in a traffic accident. Cameras also follow Dominic, another 16 year old. He was recovering at home after having his tonsils out when his throat started bleeding and he had to go to hospital

programme.title: Brain Surgeons: Between Life and Death
programme.desc: Documentary following patients undergoing life-changing brain surgery at the Neurological Centre in Southampton - one of Britain's foremost neurosurgical units, where some of the most difficult and complex operations in the country are performed. Twelve-year-old Matthew faces a gruelling two-day operation to remove an extremely rare tumour deep in his mid-brain, next to his pineal gland. This is a region key to the functioning of sight, muscles, hearing and sensation. With access to the hospital's team of leading paediatric surgeons, the programme follows the doctors' attempts at a delicate and risky operation, which could save Matthew's life

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A young man has curvature of the spine, a high temperature, low blood pressure and a fast heart rate - all triggers for the life-threatening condition sepsis. Paramedics treat a man who's been stabbed in the chest and slashed across the head. He's bleeding heavily from a head wound and needs to be treated in hospital quickly. A woman with a history of strokes suddenly loses feeling all down one side of her body

programme.title: Emergency Helicopter Medics
programme.desc: Documentary following the work of Britain's busiest air ambulance crews. In Lanchester, heli-medics struggle to free a man trapped in his mangled car. A tree surgeon falls from height in Ashdon, breaking his femur. A motorbike accident in the Peaks sees medics rushing to the aid of Jamie, who has a seriously damaged arm and other fractures

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the popular quiz with guest captain Claudia Winkleman and Johnny Vegas going up against Jon Richardson and Reginald D Hunter. Sara Pascoe joins resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, while Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Three boys are admitted for very different reasons, including cyclist Ollie, who arrives with head, neck and facial injuries having been involved in a traffic accident. Cameras also follow Dominic, another 16 year old. He was recovering at home after having his tonsils out when his throat started bleeding and he had to go to hospital

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jacqui Lockhart has worked hard all her life, and now that she has the savings available she wants to fulfil her lifelong dream of owning a holiday home on Spain's southern Costa Blanca. With a cash budget of 50,000 and the support of her daughter Judy, the pressure is on for Danni Menzies to help Jacqui secure her dream property

programme.title: Kirstie's Handmade Treasures
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp visits the Devon County Show, where she discovers the secret of home-made handscrub and learns about beekeeping and making beeswax candles. She also tries her hand at crafting jewellery in silver clay - an ideal way of making unusual but inexpensive gifts

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Danni Menzies helps sisters Kay and Faye realise their dream of buying a home in Cannes, which they'll both eventually retire to. They enjoyed many happy childhood holidays in the glamorous French city, and now want to create new memories there while pursuing their love of painting. Danni lines up five properties for them within their maximum 400,000 budget

programme.title: A New Life in the Sun
programme.desc: Glampsite owners in Portugal face the reality of living off-grid, and at a horse riding centre in France, cameras follow a mother and daughter with grand plans

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: In Cockermouth, Cumbria, Simon O'Brien and Henry Cole meet blacksmith Jon, who spent many years working on fairgrounds. At the valuation, independent valuer Ronnie Archer-Morgan reckons there's rich pickings to be made from railway memorabilia

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien continue their mission to repurpose old cast-offs into cash, making an extraordinary find from a Dutch designer in accountant Debbie's lean-to

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: After the detectives' hard work, a person visits the home of a relative she didn't know existed, and who surprisingly lives just 10 minutes' from her own house. On another case, the hunters experience a strange sense of dj vu when they trace heirs to the estate of a woman they have met before, and their search uncovers the remarkable history of Thames bargemen. Plus, details of more unclaimed estates are divulged

programme.title: Heir Hunters
programme.desc: The researchers investigate the life and work of a Glaswegian author who had lost all contact with his family, and take a trip to the home of a newspaper man from Norwich and uncover a previously unknown pension pay out of 30,000

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contest begins at Swallows Rest in Weymouth, Dorset, where hosts Jane and Keith Smith are pulling out all the stops to win. However, the colour combinations in the rooms do not go down well with rival B&B owner Ray Chowdhury, and an afternoon of drawing starts some competition between Ray and newlyweds James and Darren Kosa-Jones

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants visit the Burley Inn in the New Forest, where newlyweds Darren and James welcome their guests. Donna and David prove to have a critical eye when they discover holes in the sheets, and Jane and Keith have a disagreement over a toilet roll. In the afternoon, the couple reveal their quizmaster skills, before Ray grills them on how they run their B&B over dinner

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to Hotel Montville in Redditch, Worcestershire for the third day of the competition, where first impressions of Ray Chowdhury's unique style and decor are positive. However, room inspections leave Jane and Keith Smith threatening not to stay, and the guests grill their host about his business background at dinner. Although some light relief is given in the form of ice sculpting, breakfast disappoints James and Darren Kosa-Jones, and Ray must face the harsh reality of his guests' opinions at feedback

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The last visit is to Donna and David's Silverton B&B in Shrewsbury, where the complimentary earplugs soon have Darren and James worrying about the noise from the road outside. A Segway race helps whip up the guests' competitive spirit, Donna gets emotional when her work-life balance is questioned, and chef David proves he can handle the unexpected at breakfast

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and settle some scores. Accusations fly around the table as payments are revealed and the winner announced. Swallows Rest is first up and hosts Jane and Keith want to find out about Ray's colour preferences. Next Darren and James of the Burley Inn quiz Ray over his fussiness around their pine furniture. When it comes to the Silverton, B&B team Donna and David take umbrage with Jane and Keith's comments

programme.title: Come Dine with Me: The Professionals
programme.desc: Three teams from Nottingham host dinner for their rivals, with Becky and Mark showcasing their gastropub grub, competitive duo Antony and James serving up French-inspired posh nosh and Kyme and Gemma hoping to impress with their pub food

programme.title: Escape to the Chateau: DIY
programme.desc: Donna and Paul move into their new home in western France, but struggle with the language, while Adam from Warwickshire is hoping to join the band of expat chateau owners. Familiar faces Edward and Anna return. With Anna six months pregnant, they face an uphill battle to get everything finished before the arrival of their first wedding party of the season

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Stephen Yeoman and Anita Findlay, who want to build a cutting-edge, post-industrial house covered in rusty metal. However, their prominent riverside plot in the traditional and architecturally conservative area of South Downs means everyone will be watching. The project proves to be a real rollercoaster when the fitting of the rusty steel cladding goes wrong, cash flow problems threaten to bring work to a halt, and the couple announce that a baby is on the way

programme.title: Hitler: The Lost Tapes
programme.desc: The public and private life of the infamous dictator, featuring the photos and videos of two photographers who dedicated their lives to documenting Hitler - Heinrich Hoffmann, his official photographer, and Hoffmann's photographic assistant Eva Braun, who went on to become Hitler's wife. The archive footage includes 1,300 recently digitised, rarely seen photos taken by Hoffmann and material garnered from Eva's personal photo collection, along with more than four hours of her home videos - mostly filmed at Hitler's fortified chalet in the Bavarian Alps

programme.title: Caught on Camera
programme.desc: Real-life footage revealing what can happen when motorists venture out onto the roads, including near-death crashes, road-rage encounters and moped muggings - all captured on cameras and phones and told by those that survived to tell the tale

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Richard, who's 47, has fallen off a ladder while he was fixing his roof, and 87-year-old Doreen arrives in resus suffering from a serious infection. Elsewhere, doctors also treat five-year-old Cojo, who has come to paediatrics with his dad after injuring his elbow while he was wrestling with his brother

programme.title: The Emergency Ward
programme.desc: Dr Mya's stabbing victim is hanging onto life as he bleeds heavily. Dr David's patient has potential spinal injuries after landing on his head during a mountain bike race crash. Milo is a hit with Dr Emma during bring your dog to work day

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the hybrid panel quiz show, putting a comedy spin on Channel 4's long-running words-and-numbers game. Isy Suttie joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner, and Rachel Riley takes care of the numbers and letters

James defends the honour of the car in a very small Renault, Richard tries to prove that pedalling is faster by riding a bicycle, while Jeremy attempts to demonstrate that water is the quickest way across town by piloting a hovercraft. To make matters more complicated, all three presenters are racing not only one another but also the Stig, who is making his way toward the finish line by public transport. programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo heads to Chichester, West Sussex, where he encounters an Edwardian motoring duo patronised by King Edward VII. After a grand tour of their factory, he is treated to some rest and relaxation in one of their finest vehicles. Arriving in the resort of Southsea, Hampshire, Michael heads for the King's Theatre, where he treads the boards in a community production of Lads in the Village. Crossing the Solent, the presenter boards the Island Line to travel along the pier in a 1930s London Underground carriage, then hops on to the Isle of Wight heritage line bound for Wootton

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: In Dorset, Michael Portillo visits Brownsea Island, where Robert Baden Powell began the scout movement in the early 20th century. Joining a group of present scouts, the presenter learns to build a bivouac and finds out what it is about scouting that still appeals to boys - and girls - today. In the New Forest, Michael searches out some unsung heroes of the First World War - the ponies who became war horses - and hears their story from a commoner who runs a stable and riding school. Then in Bournemouth, the one-time MP investigates a very British institution - the beach hut

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: Fred gets his first taste of fame, but does not entirely welcome the limelight when it interrupts his work on the restoration of a wrecked steam tractor. The steeplejack is further annoyed when forced by his wife to take a holiday to Blackpool, but puts his time there to good use

programme.title: The Fred Dibnah Story
programme.desc: In 17 years of marriage, Fred and his wife have never agreed about holiday destinations and now they've decided to go on separate jaunts. Alison takes the children to Greece, while the grizzled steeplejack takes advantage of the unaccustomed peace and quiet to visit a Stockport steam rally

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo once again ventures onto the European rail network to retrace journeys featured in George Bradshaw's 1913 publication Continental Guide. He begins in Spain, where he visits the scene of an assassination attempt at a royal wedding in Madrid, before dancing with an unusual partner in Cordoba. He investigates the story behind Bizet's Carmen at a tobacco factory in Seville, learns about Winston Churchill's tense diplomatic mission to Algeciras and finishes with tales of British espionage in Gibraltar

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on another journey around the country to discover how the railways have affected people and communities, and the legacy they left. The first leg of a journey through north-west England begins in Carlisle, where investigates the Victorian appetite for the custard cream, before braving a perilous descent into the only operational slate mine in England and discovering a miniature railway

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo continues his journey through the Lake District, where he discovers a magical world of talking rabbits, ducks, hedgehogs and mice, who have entertained children for more than 100 years. At the village home of author and illustrator Beatrix Potter, he learns about her legacy and her fears about the railways. Michael presses on to Brantwood, home of the Victorian art critic, John Ruskin, and finishes with a brief encounter at Carnforth

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Armed with his 1913 railway guide, Michael Portillo travels through Italy from Turin to Venice.Along the way, he recreates a scene from the Michael Caine film The Italian Job on a Fiat test track and takes a trip in a seaplane to investigate the early 20th-century British love affair with Lake Como. In Verona, he visits the house used to attract Edwardian tourists to the alleged setting of Shakespeare's Romeo and Juliet and finds a microcosm of pre-First World War Europe at the Venice Biennale art exhibition

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo reads the riot act in Preston, and discovers four mill workers were shot dead at a protest in 1842. In Darwen, he traces developments in interior design from wallpaper to paint, before exploring the Victorian industrial landscape of Salford in the paintings on LS Lowry. He finishes his leg of the journey on Kersal Moor, where he discovers the poetry of Edwin Waugh and twists his tongue around the Lancashire dialect

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys

programme.title: Joanna Lumley's India
programme.desc: Joanna's adventures across India conclude as she explores Rajasthan, Delhi and the mountainous North West, before ending in Kashmir, the place of her birth. Her first stop takes her to the Ranthambhore National Park, where she learns about the Wildlife Protection Society of India's tiger conservation programmes. Joanna's next stop takes her to the city of Delhi, where she begins her exploration of the capital at Humayun's Tomb, before ending her 5000 mile journey in Srinagar in Kashmi, the place where she was born

programme.desc: The former steeplejack and renowned engineering expert looks back on his eventful life with a sense of satisfaction and contentment. The Boltonian then contemplates his future and the possibility of retirement

programme.title: Fred Dibnah's Made in Britain
programme.desc: Fred travels to the Lake District, which was once one of Britain's biggest sources of iron ore. He also takes a trip across a lake in a steamboat, examines how the rail industry made use of local metals, and finally enjoys a pint with former steelworkers in a local pub

programme.title: Great Continental Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo travels through Germany, learning about an Edwardian fitness craze in Dresden before heading to Leipzig on a historic line built by British engineers in 1839. He discovers model-railway making on the grandest of scales in Hamburg and ends his journey in Kiel, where he reveals how British yachtsmen spied on the German navy in the early 20th century

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: On the last leg of his journey through north-west England, Michael Portillo makes a clean sweep in Ashley, Cheshire, where in Victorian times the new middle classes set up home in suburban villas with multiple chimneys swept by children. In Macclesfield, he finds the end of the Silk Route and tries his hand at screen printing. Then after stoking the fire on the steam-powered Churnet Valley Railway, the former politician alights at Froghall, Staffordshire, heading for Alton Towers to trace the 19th-century origins of the theme park

programme.title: Great British Railway Journeys
programme.desc: Michael Portillo embarks on a new railway journey along the south coast of England. Beginning in the port of Dover, he takes a plunge into the English Channel, inspired by the example set by a brave 19th-century sea captain. A miniature steam train one third the size of a conventional locomotive conveys him from Romney Marsh to Dungeness, and in Eastbourne, he learns how the 7th Duke of Devonshire managed to market the town's attractions to the refined upper-crust of Victorian London. The first leg of his trip concludes in eccentric style at the Glyndebourne opera festival on the South Downs

The team plans to bring the best of the Cumbrian landscape to the Pynes' awkwardly shaped garden, complete with a refuge for their 14-year-old daughter Milly, who has faced her own health problems over the years

Finally, James and Victoria have chosen a menu themed around their favourite holiday destination of Spain

programme.desc: Jasmine Harman embarks on a property search on the Caribbean island of Saint Vincent on behalf of Staffordshire couple David and Pamela Dale. Jasmine soon finds that a budget of 200,000 and house-hunters with uncompromising tastes force her to take drastic action to locate a suitable home

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: In Almera, husband and wife Steve and Sharon Garner help food fans Adam and Simon find their perfect holiday home, which they eventually hope to retire to, for a budget of 180,000 euros. Over the border on the Algarve, husband and wife Andrew and Katie, who moved to Portugal a year ago and have spent the past 12 months living with Katie's father, are eager to find a place to call their own

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: A couple from Norwich get married at their hamlet in the Limousin. Meanwhile, in the Dordogne region, two estate agents reveal plans to renovate a stunning chateau. And in Portugal, a couple from Eastbourne try to pick themselves up after a wild fire rips through their village

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien find unique items lost in people's homes to fix up for a profit. The boys head east to Suffolk to meet Margaret - an avid collector and former mayor - so need to be on their best behaviour

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Hairdresser Julie hosts the first of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham, hoping to win over her guests with a no-nonsense menu she can prepare in advance. Joining her are tough-talking prison transport officer Tina, dreadlocked farm-dweller Stephen, superior IT manager David and glamorous beauty-school teacher Ashleigh. Alliances are quickly forged when David and Tina discover they both love a good gossip, before they turn their attention to Stephen when David compares him to a tramp. Julie overcooks her beef, but will her hosting make up for it and bag her the 1,000 prize?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Beauty teacher Ashleigh throws the second of the week's parties in Co Durham, she hopes a menu of sophisticated dishes - along with a helping of hearts and love - will help her win the cash prize. However, cracks were already beginning to show in the diners' genial facade yesterday, and the hostess realises she must play peacemaker if she is to keep everyone from falling out

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Call centre complaints officer and part-time farmer Stephen hosts the third night of a week of dinner parties in Co Durham. He hopes to win the 1,000 prize money by impressing his guests with an evening on his farm, featuring a drinks reception and rustic cuisine. However, self-confessed snob Tina makes it perfectly clear what she thinks of his efforts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Prison transport officer Tina is the fourth host in Co Durham. She hopes to impress her guests with a sophisticated French menu including salmon crepes, chicken and posh peas and pear dessert. But having been highly critical of everyone else's food so far, will they now take the chance to get their own back or can she win them round?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Contestants try to outdo one another by throwing the perfect dinner party, which is then judged on its merits by their rivals

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi goes house-hunting in Oliva, in Spain's Valencia region, hoping to find a suitable holiday home for keen cyclists Debbie and Graham from Portsmouth

programme.desc: AJ Odudu hosts as collectors bid for a pinball machine signed by Elton John, a fork liberated from Saddam Hussein's palace and a prototype mid-century chair brought in by two sisters who have different feelings about it but are equally desperate to sell it. Plus a 1940s 'fly-o-plane' fairground attraction that was once used to train fighter pilots

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Surgeons must plan their next move carefully when Daisy, a 22-month-old girl, arrives at St George's Hospital by air ambulance after being kicked in the head by a horse at her family's stables. Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mike, who has a form of medication-resistant epilepsy, arrives in minors with a bandage around his jaw after falling face-first onto the pavement. Plus, 100-year-old Florence, who was diagnosed with dementia three years earlier, and her daughter Frances arrive at the hospital when the former suffers what appears to be a stroke

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics get in Eurovision mood as they sit down for the annual song contest. They also watch spy thriller Citadel, new dating show I Kissed a Boy, Open House: The Great Sex Experiment, as well as The Greatest Auction, Family Fortunes and The Big Celebrity Detox

programme.title: Gogglebox
programme.desc: The armchair critics share their opinions on shows from late 2021, including I'm a Celebrity, Get Me Out of Here!, True Story, Miriam and Alan: Lost in Scotland, Tiger King 2, Close to Me and Inside Beverly Hills: The Land of the Rich and Famous. Plus, news coverage of the illegal Channel crossings and the emergence of the Omicron variant of the coronavirus. Narrated by Craig Cash

programme.title: Trading Places (1983)

Comedy, starring Dan Aykroyd, Eddie Murphy, Jamie Lee Curtis, Ralph Bellamy, Don Ameche and Denholm Elliott

programme.title: Sean Lock: Purple Van Man
programme.desc: The late lamented comedian's stand-up show, recorded in front of a sell-out audience at London's Hammersmith Apollo in 2013. Sean offers a uniquely skewed take on the world through gags, opinions, deft observations and silly voices as he gives the 'purple van man's' perspective on life

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me

However, some of the guests have reservations about the host, meaning he has his work cut out for him

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me

Night two sees competitive foodies Flora and Chris put on a restaurant-inspired meal, including a surprise amuse-bouche. The third evening sees proud east Londoners Cecelia and Paul do their best to mellow the spices

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: A Place in the Sun

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses

Fast forward two years and the sisters are back to find out if the couple are now marching to the same beat and living their shared dream. In Almera, Sharon and Steve Garner catch up with former client Mary, who left Ireland's Co Kildare after she bagged a bargain abode for 25,000 euros under its asking price

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Part-time model and writer Azzi Kalili hosts the first dinner party in west London. She erects a Moroccan marquee in her garden, but seems oblivious to her freezing guests and their dislike of her food

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Plumber Steve Capel hosts the second party in west London, putting together his favourite dish, a roulade of ostrich, kudu and springbok. However, his plans to entertain the other diners with a demonstration of his nunchuk skills are cut abruptly short when an injury sustained in the kitchen comes back to haunt him

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Ex-wedding planner and self-confessed perfectionist Zae Greenwood hosts the third dinner party in west London. He tries to impress his guests with a wedding-style menu, but they do not respond well to his culinary efforts

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Events organiser Emma Boardman Magliocchetti hosts the penultimate dinner party in west London. She hopes to prove to her new Italian husband that she can be the perfect wife and create an incredible feast, despite never having cooked a three-course meal before

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Jane Welch hosts the final dinner party in west London, and has asked her guests to appear in fancy dress. programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Rita and Stephen from Watford, Hertfordshire, have visited the lively Portuguese town of Albufeira over 40 times now and are finally looking to buy their own holiday home there. They want somewhere that's close to both the beach and all the action for their budget of 150,000. Jasmine Harman lines up five potential properties for them to choose between

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Craig Rowe meets Gill and Rhys from Leicestershire. With Gill already retired and Rhys soon to follow, they are looking to fulfil their dream of leaving the UK and moving to Bergerac in the Dordogne countryside. Armed with a budget of 190,000, Craig tries to find the perfect property for them

programme.title: The Dog House
programme.desc: Collie cross puppy Joey is a popular dog around the kennels, and has been a reliable buddy for the anxious dogs - but will he prove the same support to Holly, Adam and their son Oscar? Toy poodle Gizmo tries to overcome his social anxieties to win the hearts of Fiona and Maisie, a mother and daughter coming to terms with their future separation, and a lurcher with a broken tail requires lots of care - and with any luck, a forever home

programme.title: Bad Boys for Life (2020)
programme.desc: Isabel Aretas, the widow of crime lord Benito, escapes from a Mexican prison with the help of her son, Armando. She sends him to Miami to recover the stash of money his father had hidden, as well as assassinating those responsible for his dad's arrest and eventual death in prison. She demands that Armando kill Miami detective Mike Lowrey last. Action sequel, starring Will Smith, Martin Lawrence, Paola Nunez and Vanessa Hudgens

programme.title: Taskmaster
programme.desc: Contenders Frankie Boyle, Ivo Graham, Jenny Eclair, Kiell Smith-Bynoe and Mae Martin continue to address the challenges set for them by Greg Davies. The comics inventively repurpose umbrellas and - in a fitting climax - Frankie goes to town on a gigantic cat scratching post. As usual, Alex Horne helps maintain order

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong. A slip on fallen crab apples in the street leaves a woman in agony with a suspected broken hip. An afternoon spent pottering in the garden ends with a fall headfirst into a brick wall. A bicycle leaves a young man with a swollen kneecap that paramedics suspect is broken, while picking up a prescription from the chemist ends with a collapse and a trip to hospital

programme.title: Rescue: Extreme Medics

In South Ayrshire, an 86-year-old grandmother is struggling to breathe after a high-speed crash, and 72-year-old William has a severe cut to his arm after an attempt to chop wood with a circular saw went horrifically wrong

programme.title: Grand Designs: The Streets
programme.desc: Tim plans to move from his small flat in Bicester into an architecturally daring home at the UK's largest mass self-build site in Graven Hill. With the help of his dad Michael, the project is supposed to be a chance to spend quality time together outside of work but the stress begins to ramp up when the five-tonne car lift Tim ordered from China doesn't fit into the specially prepared hole in the basement. Plus, Kevin and Natasha revisit Jitinder, whose house was unfinished due to the moisture problems and his resin floor last time they met, now they experience the full splendour of his Hollywood Hills style home

programme.desc: Graham and Sarah turn their attention to the garden, as they set out to turn Graham's picture of what he hopes the view from their kitchen may eventually look like into a reality. programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third night in Newcastle sees sophisticated marketing consultant Liz trying to impress her guests with a fancy French-themed menu. However, she spends most of her time trying to keep the peace as outspoken comedy promoter David annoys club singer John and rubs mum-of-three Clare up the wrong way with his snobbish views

programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The first hosts in north London, recently engaged couple Anita and Cash, serve up a menu that draws on their Indian heritage. On day two, laughter-loving Keith and his laid-back wife Maz dish out good, honest food, but with foodie guests judging them, they're a bit worried. Dan and Les, who've been married for 17 years, host last. Self-confessed food snob Dan has devised a starter with eight separate elements. Will their risky choices and haute cuisine appeal to their guests?

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jonnie Irwin helps Frankie and Gill Phibbs search for the home they have always dreamt of owning on Spain's Costa de la Luz. It has taken 20 years for the couple's plans to come to fruition and, having sold their family home in West Sussex and with a budget of 180,000, the pair are keen to seize the day and embark on their new life

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Jasmine Harman meets Clive and Carol Stephens, who want to relocate from their family home in Romford, Essex, to St Lucia in the Caribbean, so she searches the island for their dream property on a budget of 250,000

programme.title: Sun, Sea and Selling Houses
programme.desc: Retired bricklayer Paul plans to lay down new roots in Alicante, hoping to find a place where he can barbecue under sunny skies - although wife Jean's only request is a dishwasher

programme.title: Help! We Bought a Village
programme.desc: In France, work is under way to repair the old church at a purpose-built ramshackle Catholic holiday village in France, and the owners of a hamlet wake up to find it has flooded. In Italy, the owners of an earthquake-damaged borgo find out that caring for their property is not as easy as they thought

programme.title: Find It, Fix It, Flog It
programme.desc: Henry Cole and Simon O'Brien head to Brighton to meet recycler Cat, who has tons of junk in a series of sea containers. Henry salvages a children's scooter, while Simon constructs the largest corkscrew that valuer Ronnie has ever seen

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition visits the Nottingham and Derby area. American Hali kicks proceeding off with a travel-inspired menu, including Moroccan chicken cigars and an unusual dessert combination. With a very gregarious gathering of guests, the food plays second fiddle to a fun night of impressions, dance moves and kitchen chaos

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The competition continues in the Nottingham and Derby area. Car salesman Alistair hopes to step the competition up a gear. However, after narrowly avoiding an argument last night with Lesley, the veteran of the group, he's treading on thin ice. And he's serving up a bizarre menu, including chilli soup - for dessert - and prunes

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Nottingham, fun-loving funeral arranger Kim hosts an evening packed with games galore and a mixed bag menu. Fifty-seven-year-old Lesley is again the butt of car salesman Alistair's geriatric jibes and takes great delight in watching him put on the spot during a dance-off

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Customer relations associate and part-time drag queen Adam plans a theatrical night of flamboyance as the culinary competition continues in the Derby and Nottingham area. Can he get his guests begging for an encore, will Alastair and Lesley ever kiss and make up and what will Adam's guests think of his secret hobby as a ufologist?

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The final soiree in the Nottingham and Derby area sees 57-year-old Lesley counting on a night of glamour and glitz - plus some good home-cooked food - to secure the 1,000 prize. However, before any food is even dished up, the guests make a surprising discovery about the host

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Michelle and Bernard from Bolton first visited the stunning Italian city of Lucca a year ago and immediately fell in love with its traditional Tuscan charm and beautiful countryside. The couple now want to buy a holiday home in a nearby town or village, which they can enjoy with their whole family. Helping to fulfil their dream is Ben Hillman, who lines up five options up for their 75,000 budget

programme.title: A Place in the Sun
programme.desc: Julie and Leo are looking for a holiday home to suit three generations of their family. Leah Charles-King takes them and their budget of 120,000 to the southern Costa Blanca with hopes of finding the perfect property

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E

Meanwhile, 54-year-old Mike, who has a form of medication-resistant epilepsy, arrives in minors with a bandage around his jaw after falling face-first onto the pavement. Plus, 100-year-old Florence, who was diagnosed with dementia three years earlier, and her daughter Frances arrive at the hospital when the former suffers what appears to be a stroke

programme.title: 999: On the Front Line
programme.desc: A man involved in a car crash needs to be carefully removed from his vehicle to protect his spine. It's also a day when everyday errands go badly wrong.
